description:
Really great coffee! I've been here a couple of times and it never disappoints. Sometimes there is a wait but it's worth it. The best thing to do is to get your drink to go as there is usually very limited seating and it's always full. Sometimes there is also a wait for your drink, especially if it's the afternoon on a weekday. 

I love the latte and cappuccino, but need to try the pour overs as these also seem good!
author: Valeria S.

description:
Looking into this coffee shop, you almost get a library vibe from it. Yet this place is distinctly on trend. The unique set up makes it perfect for working, chatting with friends or even just relaxing by yourself.

The great vibes make it such a shame that the food did not live up to my expectations. The waffle was nice enough but, when compared to places like Pain, it must be considered mediocre. The cookie skirted the line of bearable with its flavour and sugar on top. 

As for the service, you had to go up to a till to order and I appreciate the set up but my coffee and waffle took too long in comparison to those in England. 

Overall, I went to this place for vibes and got exactly that but the food was disappointing. If you are in San Francisco, I recommend going to this restaurant if you just want to chill out and get a break from the busy city but go to another coffee shop for good food!
author: George W.

description:
Is the coffee bold?  Yes.
Is the coffee flavorful?  Yes.
Is the service friendly?  Yes.
Is the coffee smooth?  Yes.
Would I stand in that incredibly long line again?  No!

The wait was unbelievable so I had to see what the hype was about.  Although the coffee was good, it's not worth the long wait in my opinion.  Be sure to stop by if you don't see a line.
author: Chira E.

description:
This Blue Bottle Coffee is just plain cool. Nestled inside the lobby of a classic office building in downtown San Francisco, this modern bar looks almost as great as their coffee drinks. Access is though the lobby without a dedicated entrance with only street parking available. 

My Sunday morning visit was packed with Outside Lands visitors trying to catch a morning buzz. There were a few morning runners and maybe a few bringing a drink back to their Saturday night guest! This location has a pretty full menu including a wonderful reserve Rwandan espresso which was amazing on a cool and sunny morning. 

Gourmet coffee is a wonderful treat, and the Blue Bottle on Sansome is a wonderful way to experience it. The surrounding neighborhood is a little dead on the weekends, but I'm glad to see the living visit this outpost.
author: Kristian D.

description: We stumbled on Blue Bottle on a Sunday on our way out of San Francisco.   I had a latte and a cherry oat bar - delicious!   Servers were friendly and we had a great conversation waiting for our coffee.  It wasn't busy, Sunday am in the Financial District!  We will definitely go again.
author: Vala R.

description: The coffee here is seriously THAT good!!!  I have heard lots of raving reviews of this place and it definitely lives up to its reputation! The service was super friendly and quick! I ordered their New Orleans iced coffee and it was fantastic! Super super smooth and creamy and does not leave a but of tartness in your mouth during or after the drink! However they are doing it they are doing it right!
author: Paula C.

description:
I've been to many cafes and coffee shops all over CA, but nothing compares to Blue Bottle. I make sure I come whenever I'm home in SF, you truly cannot beat the friendly service, cool atmosphere, and deliciously incomparable coffee. I've tried everything on the menu, and it has never disappointed, neither has the handsome barista ;) I could not recommend this place more. 5/5 
-Savannah
author: Savannah G.

description:
A cool, modern coffee shop with plenty of windows, white marble counters, and high ceilings. As expected, the prices are on the high side for caffeine, but I did enjoy my "New Orleans" iced coffee. It had the right level of sweetness and milk. Plus, there were some free cookie samples that I tried as well and they paired well with the beverage. 

Hugs,
C
author: Christopher G.

description:
Great ambience and friendly baristas didn't quite make up for the long line to order followed by even longer wait for a simple cup of hot chocolate.

While my coffee drinking friends raved about their cafe latte with soy, I found my drink more lukewarm than hot and oddly bitter rather than sweet.

This is a popular location and great for people watching. Breakfast menu selections limited to pastries and oatmeal.

As I was about to toss the cup, a homeless guy outside the store asked for the remaining dregs which I quickly relinquished.
author: Sharon H.

description:
What a disappointment, we have been to other locations and were looking for a coffee shop to hang out and work a bit before a meeting. 

Long line (was expected), very expensive for a small cup of iced latte. 

"There is NO outlets in the entire coffee shop!!"
"There is NO wifi connection to work on your laptop!!" 

So don't go there to do any work only if you love to pay for an expensive cup of coffee!!
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
Five stars for really good coffee.  And they have Oatly, which is becoming more common but a lot of coffee shops still don't carry it.

One star for the experience.  It's unbelievably loud inside.  The high ceilings and total lack of absorbent materials help create a loud, chaotic environment.  Add in the thumping music and the noise from the bar on the other side of the lobby (excellent drinks over there) and it's a place you'll be eager to get away from.  Unfortunately, service tends toward glacial.  From the few times I've been here, a 10 minute wait from order to served is not unusual.
author: Jason F.

description: Oh blue bottle. How I love you. The chances of one opening anywhere near where I live is slim. But I can dream. I can hope. And when I travel and find one, I will visit.
author: Basil M.

description:
Good coffee, nice baristas and a comfortable environment to sip my mocha. 

I think my coffee standards have gone up since starting to make my own lattes at work using the expression machine and only coffee and milk. That said the mocha was on the sweet side for me so I'll probably try something else next time. 

On a Saturday morning, there were several open seats to pick from.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Short Story:  Hands down the best coffee chain in SF!

Long Story:  I've been to several blue bottles and other coffee places in SF.  This is by far the best coffee chain and one of the best locations.  You absolutely cannot go wrong with Blue Bottle.  They have excellent drip coffees, cold brews, affagatos, liege waffles, cookies, brownies, lattes, espresso, etc...I'm getting hungry and thirsty just tying this.  Almost everything here is handmade and the Treasury building is quite nice.  I highly recommend the waffle...it's super awesome!

Long Story:  I'm typing this review as I'm in line :)
author: Michael W.

description:
The coffee is so good, you'll be tweaking out because of how strong it is. I came here with my co worker mid day about a week ago and I must say that if you're looking for some strong coffee to energize you half way through the day Blue Bottle Coffee is my recommendation. I highly recommend coming here at least once or twice if you're in the area. I've ordered at least once of everything on the menu and regardless of what it is you get it's all good.

My favorites include the New Orleans, the Affogato, and of course, the waffle! The waffle isn't a drink if you're asking, but it's a really bomb ass waffle. We're talking fluffy, sweet, made to order, fresh, crunchy, and perfect to-go. No need for syrup or powder sugar. It's perfect just the way it is. 

If it wasn't expensive, I'd get it everyday but once a month or every other week doesn't hurt the bank too much. Hahahaha
author: Tina M.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee is a bay area favorite when it comes to deliciously brewed coffee, and it is now enjoying its continuous existence under big papa Nestle.

Now, big papa Nestle hasn't done me wrong yet since Blue Bottle is just as good as I remember during my last visit here. I came here on a Wednesday afternoon with a friend after lunch to grab a cup of joe before heading back to our offices for work. It's a nice and simple cafe with a small selection of brews and some seating inside. They also sell coffee grinds, snacks, merch and what not too. I just have to say that finding the entrance was a bit of a struggle though since there isn't a direct entrance into the cafe, but instead, one must enter the highrise it is connected to to enter the cafe. At around 1pm in the afternoon, there was only about a 5 min wait to the cashier which was nice.

After quite a bit of deliberations, I decided to go simple and get their hot caffe latte. It felt a bit pricy for the size, but it was definitely a nice cup of latte that was neither too acidic nor bitter. I also got to try out a sip of their Oakland blend which is a drip coffee. My friend described it as having the taste of teriyaki beef jerky which made me burst out in laughter since that sounded absurd! However, once I tasted it, the same exact thought ran through my mind. It might sound offputting and strange, but it was still an interestingly good cup of coffee that I could see myself getting on a next visit. If you want to experience the colorful and magnificent joys that come with this now dubbed "tetiyaki beef jerky drip coffee", make no hestitaion whatsoever in purchasing some of them oakland blends!
author: Joshua M.

description:
Ever wondered why Blue Bottle Coffee is called... Blue Bottle? Why is it not called Green Bottle or Pink Bottle? Read here for the story: https://bluebottlecoffee.com/our-story

Blue Bottle coffee serves only the freshest coffee. The beans are roasted no more than 48 hours ago. Despite the long line that snaked outside the store, I decided to wait. I had a drip coffee, they make each cup individually. I also tried the new Orleans cold brew which is sweetened with cane sugar. It is not too sweet, just right. I definitely saw a lot of people ordering Liege waffles, these are made to order. They smelled so good. Unfortunately I had other food plans sop I didn't have a waffle.

Blue Bottle isn't cheap by any means, but if you like drinking good coffee, it is worth the splurge.
author: Stephanie Q.

description:
Blue Bottle is solid for the world of coffee connoisseurs. You can get your pinky finger poppin drinks inside a pristine marble environment. It is beautiful architecture, with nice moldings and interesting chandeliers but who gives a fuck, you came for some hyphy ass coffee! 

Located in FiDi, expect to be around suits and techies. Line is usually long but the wait is not bad. The employees are fast, efficient, super friendly and nice, (except one). It's pretty obvious who's the one that either doesn't like their job or me but who cares because the rest of them are super dope. You have to have one sucka around so we can compare and truly appreciate all the other awesome people. 

Highlights for a person who just likes his coffee black and beautiful

- Service is exceptional
- Oat milk option (highly recommend Oat Latté and Iced Oat Latté)
- Waffle is amazing ( not too sweet)

Deltas: 

- Drip is meh, nothing spectacular about it. I don't really get the drip thang, sorry but not sorry.
- Wish I didn't have to go get cup covers. Why can't they just put it on already. Such a hassle.

Overall, best part of experience is interacting with the workers! It doesn't seem formulaic as each has their own unique personality. They are either genuinely friendly people or just really trained well not to be fake under the circumstance.
author: Glenn A.

description:
Blue Bottle serves up a great cup of coffee with a decent price tag. With that said, it's still great coffee. If you want something strong, I highly recommend their cold brew, something sweet then their iced coffee, and something creamy then their latte. Actually all their coffee options are great.

This location is super super busy during the work week. You can almost always expect a line but it moves pretty fast. The cafe is lined with large windows that gives you a nice view of the street for people watching and allow the illusive SF sunshine to pour through and illuminate the cafe. There is seating if you prefer to enjoy your cup of coffee in the cafe.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Pros: Blue Bottle Coffee. It's delicious. Duh. Awesome baristas. Great atmosphere.
Con: No wifi, so I guess you need to actually talk to people in this joint!
author: Michael K.

description:
The first time I had Blue Bottle coffee was at their ferry building location. The lines were long, and I waited at least 30 minutes for my first cold brew. A long wait! Not sure if anything is worth a long wait, and everything is pricey, but the coffee was sweet and yummy. 

Tried the waffle today: fluffy and warm! Kind of small, though, and not sweet.

Blue Bottle at this location has no wifi, but it's great for sitting down for coffee in a beautiful setting. Marble tabletops, high ceilings, glass windows, brightly lit. Perfect for weekend morning readings and people watching.
author: Julianna K.

description: One of my favorite coffee places in San Francisco! I would highly recommend getting the Hayes Valley cafe!
author: Miguel E.

description:
Mocha... Smooth. Satisfying! When I took my first sip, I literally said to myself in my head, "Oh my God, this is sooo good!" 

The line was long, but the turnover is quick so you're not waiting long. There is plenty of seating, and although there were a lot of people, I was able to find two seats without a problem. I love the big windows and how bright and inviting the whole place was. This really is a great spot for great coffee!
author: Angie Y.

description: I went here after brunch on Sunday, and it was very low-key (I'm sure its an entirely different vibe during the work week). This was my first Blue Bottle Coffee experience, and it lived up to the hype! I had the NOLA cold brew, and it was SO good. The space has super high ceilings, is airy and beautiful, and there are a good number of seats. Would definitely return!
author: Thu P.

description:
I've never had Blue Bottle before and when I was away for college, I vividly remember their packaging at a grocery store. It was something that caught my eye and drew me in. But, I've usually have had a bad experience with coffee, so me purchasing it would just be silly. I took a photo regardless. And it was forever was just a lasting impression.. an imprint in my mind.

Fast-forward, I see an opportunity which I'll leave out for now or maybe forever.. that has to do with their coffee. 

And since I've never had it, my friend decided today was the day I was going to have Blue Bottle. So we walked to one location. Unfortunately it was closed on weekends. And I honestly was going to try on a different day on my own.. But, my friend swiftly looked up a different location nearby so we walked to that one. 

And it was super nice: the building (the interior of the building)it was in was gorgeous. And the shop itself had a nice ambiance.  

-

I got the New Orleans Iced Coffee. 

The New Orleans is composed of milk, cane sugar, and roasted chicory. 

My friend says they usually make it for you, but it was a pre-made and then but together. So they were disappointed for me. But, it was good nonetheless. I didn't feel jittery that day. The chicory was a nice touch.
author: Lilian L.

description:
My favorite coffee shop! Love their strong coffee, bright and airy atmosphere, fast and friendly service, and this particular location is in a beautiful building in the heart of fidi.

Usually get my staple cappuccino. Their almond milk is also thick and creamy (not the watered down kind).

Please note, I am a huge fan of very strong and small portions of coffee, efficient service, and simple menus - so this place does it for me. Two thumbs up.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I come to this location about five days out of the week. The drip coffee, mocha, and New Orleans are all delicious. The staff is friendly to the point of being personable. They greet me by name, and move quickly with my order. They are always doing the best they can to help. The ambiance is nice when it's quiet, and the crowds have dissipated a bit. I have been here when the line is out the door, and the staff is incredibly patient - it's not their fault that the line is so long. The line is long because people take too long to put in their order and don't have their money out to pay quickly. 

It's amazing that some people on this forum have given poor reviews based on silly things like wait time, wifi accessibility, or not being able to have their business meeting. Every time I see someone at a coffee shop spreading out all of their belongings (laptop, phone, notebook, coat, and my personal favorite, dirty backpack or briefcase) ON THE TABLE, I automatically think you're an entitled, arrogant person. Everyone is paying the same price to be there. It's a coffee shop, not your personal work space. Leave your stuff in your office, respect your fellow habitues, AND the staff.
author: Alexandres M.

description: Jose is a fantastic barrista -- I am in awe of his craftsmanship and commitment to delivering an amazing oat latte experience. Highly recommended
author: Sarah B.

description:
Walked in on a Sunday afternoon! Every time I passed by before, just too many people to get in. But today is my day! Finally got the chance!

I ordered the coffee latte. Even there was a few people waiting, it took a little time to wait. I am okay with that since they are all hand made?blew coffee and worth to wait: )

The coffee latte taste so good! And I am impressed with the temperature of it! Just right warm to have it right away! Not to hot to hit my tough, but warm enough for the windy day in sf!

Hope to have it next time!!
author: Yantong Z.

description:
Blue Bottle is Amazing!!!!
Great location.
Nice ambience- cozy and elegant.
Very friendly staff and superior customer service.
I had cold brew and my wife had latte.
Plus- they only use Clover Milk!!!!!
author: Mahmood H.

description: A must visit if you're from out of town. Love this location since it's bigger than most others. The lattes are good, the pour overs even better!
author: Vladi Z.

description:
Amazing coffee, great location, and lots of seating. Really pretty aesthetic (go ahead, take some pictures for Instagram), seating, and tables, and there are a few outlets if you want to camp out and do work there. I waited for a friend for a while and they didn't seem to mind or care that I was reading and charging my phone without buying something (maybe because I didn't look sketchy, who knows.)

Really good coffee. There is usually a line, but it fluctuates. Really good drip coffee (which is what I got), but I heard you can't go wrong with everything, including cold brews, affragatos, snacks and pastries, and more.
author: Lizzie S.

description: I got an almond milk iced latte. It was so mediocre for the ridiculous price tag. Tasted very watered down, and I already requested for less ice. Not worth the hype, although apparently you don't go to blue bottle for their espresso, you go there for their iced coffee. I haven't tried their iced coffee, so I can't speak for that. Not convinced to go back though.
author: Grace C.

description:
Great location, and great coffee.  The store is beautiful (clean, modern, and tons of natural light) and the coffee is very good (as it is at all Blue Bottle locations.  The line can be very erratic throughout the day but you're generally going to wait 10-20 minutes in total for you coffee.  There are lots of small tables available to 'meet-up' though they're typically pretty packed non-stop throughout the day.  

Now that Nestle has acquired Blue Bottle, I hope they don't ruin the coffee / experience - I suppose time will tell.
author: Tom G.

description:
Strong, delicious coffee. Blue Bottle, you never disappoint.

I live and work in the east bay; I was in FiDi for a couple of days to do a training and both days, I stopped by to grab some black, dark roast coffee. If you truly love coffee, go for the Three Africas pour over.

The space is nice, and seating in the morning actually wasn't impossible!
author: Michelle K.

description: A lil pricey for sure, but I love coming here before I hit Orangetheory a few blocks down. Today was actually my first time trying an espresso. I was definitely not expecting the caffeine to get me so badly (like, I literally couldn't stop shaking the entire day), but the baristas know how to make a clean, strong espresso. I'd also like to add that they're amazing at making you feel welcome into the shop without making the small talk too awkward. I'm officially making this my go-to spot for my Sunday caffeine fix!
author: Connie X.

description:
Blue Bottle is continuously expanding and showing increasing growth. But this BB location, which is located in a historical office building, has a combination of a very sleek look with a museum-feel.

But one beverage that hasn't changed since I was first introduced from Blue Bottle is the crafty and gourmet mocha. Made with local Scharffen-berger cocoa and organic milk, the $5.00 beverage is still one of my favorite mocha. Blue Bottle mocha is THE only mocha I will only drink. 

This location also sells food and accessories to brew that perfect beverage. 

When I first started yelping back in 2006, Blue Bottle was one of the hottest businesses in the Bay Area. Even on this day, BB still is and doing well with more locations. With more locations, I am happy I don't need to travel to Hayes Valley and wait in the long line.
author: Matt G.

description: Pretty good capuccino. Please is really small but has 2 tables out in front to watch ppl traffic.
author: Froilan A.

description:
Over the years, I've watched the progression of Blue Bottle Coffee open new coffee houses in New York City. I've always said HA! This is a NYC thing but in all actuality, Blue Bottle Coffee was started in Oakland CA. 

What they make and its what I jones for is their Iced, chicory root coffee. OMG, its crazy-good! First it's sweetened with cane sugar then the chicory kicks in like a mutha. Perfection

We finally walk into the cafe, its very hard to find. I'm looking for 115 Sansom St, there's no signage that says Blue Bottle Coffee. I walk into an office building and ask the front desk, where the heck is Blue Bottle Coffee? He points to the scaffolding and construction, there it is. Uncool BBC, uncool.

I order a New Orleans Iced Coffee as well as a small espresso. Everything come out and I'm almost crying at this point. My wife looks at me and rolls her eyes. I let her taste the iced coffee and she says its ok. It's ok?! Ah, she grew up eating Ragu out of a jar. I don't care.

Blue Bottle Coffee, hard as hell to find but worth it for that New Orleans Iced Coffee.
author: Bill S.

description:
It's better than drip coffee but not worth the exorbitant price. Coffee tasted ok, not the best.
Waited for almost 15 minutes and it wasn't that busy :( Wouldn't recommend traveling across the city for this coffee. Definitely don't consider it if you're in a rush.
author: Jess G.

description: My favorite coffee spot in the area. Something different from the popular chains. This is a gem that helped us have a fantastic start to our day.
author: Alden K.

description: After years of hearing about Blue Bottle, I finally tried it. I'm usually a vanilla latte kind of gal but I found out while looking at the menu that they don't offer the traditional syrups for their coffee. So I was super hesitant to order anything but decided to just settle for an oat latte instead. And surprisingly, it wasn't bad!! It was smooth and the oat milk gave it a nice flavor. I also really enjoyed the atmosphere and the modern interior design of the location. I'd go back if I'm in town again.
author: Tila S.

description: Really strong drip coffee, it seems to only come in one size. Lots of space in the cafe to sit and the marble tables are so pretty!
author: Rosey L.

description: Overall a great cappuccino among other coffee selections. If you're looking to pair your coffee with some yummy pastries this is not the place.
author: Yvonne W.

description:
This blue bottle has a weird seating area and because of that it's difficult to hear when they call your order up when it's ready.

Standard blue bottle fair here, I am always a fan of the new orleans but you can also order some of the more involved drip coffee.

Takes card (thanks sf Tech scene) but there's limited snacks which is a count against to me since i believe coffee shops should always have enough snacks to keep me occupied whether i'm feeling savory or sweet with my cuppa joe.
author: Kelly E.

description:
Had a good experience here. I came here before work around 9:30 AM. 

Service: there was an average size line and it went pretty quick. My drink was ready like 6 minutes after I ordered it.

Food/drink: my latte was good, but nothing was that special about it. Nothing to complain about either I guess. 
 
The oatmeal muffin-pastry was really good. It had apples in it and was a perfect little breakfast snack with my drink. 

Ambiance: inside it was hard to get a seat, but I got one by the window where you can see the buildings. Great place to get coffee and chill before work.
author: Hayley D.

description:
If you're looking for the true Blue Bottle experience, go to the flagship Mint Plaza and Embarcadero locations instead. If you're looking for a nice cafe to impress your coffee date, come here. This somewhat nondescript location in the heart of Financial District belies a beautiful interior.

The location is on the corner and bottom floor of a 15 story office building. As you enter the lobby supervised by a security guard, the lobby flows naturally into the cafe. The seating and space centers around the cafe in an oval shape, like the cafe equivalent of a restaurant's open kitchen. There are a handful of tables and a long stretch of bar seating and stools along the long wall. The high ceilings and bright lighting make for a great ambience.

On this particular day, the staff was having some issues with the espresso machines, so drinks took much longer than expected. However, the baristas apologized profusely and even gave us a free drink card due to the inconvenience.

Bottom line, I had a lovely time at this Blue Bottle and will certainly be back!
author: Tim X.

description:
I'm taking the seat near the window, staring at the deserted Sansome Street on this Sunday morning, and thinking to myself: why do I keep paying $4 for a small cup of Cappuccino. Why.

Thoughts spinning while my body is slowly handling the coffee. Still no conclusion. 

I give up, grab my bag, and get a $4 Croissant on the way out.

Nicely done, Blue Bottle.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
OK so here's the thing that noone talks about. The coffee here is delicious (that's not the thing) but it's so unbelievably strong. For someone who's not a daily coffee drinker, my visit here yesterday caused some serious problems. 

Don't get me wrong, when I say delicious I mean like the absolute most delicious mocha I've ever had in my life.

I took about an hour to drink it because I was in a meeting and didn't want the meeting to end the second we both drained our cups. 

As I was heading home I felt woozy. Nauseous, had a pounding headache and my hands started to shake like an alkie. 

By the time I got home I just felt sick. I drank a gallon of water and that's it for the rest of the day. Spent a long time under the duvet. Couldn't function. 

Was it delicious? Yes. The best, as a matter of fact. But worth the coffee hangover? No! It was a waste of a day because I ordered a coffee that unbeknownst to me, was so strong it basically put me out of action for the rest of the day. 

I get it that coffee is an exclusive little club just like wine or whisky. And maybe as a social coffee drinker, not an habitual one, the coffee is going to make me tremor or have a raised heart rate or feel a little quesy. But for like 8 hours afterwards? I had the coffee at 11.30am and didn't get to sleep until 3.30am. 

I feel like a teenager who's never had liquor ordering a strong whisky and drinking it like a shot. Phew! I just don't know if I'm right or wrong to feel that it was a little unfair that the coffee was so, so strong and my body couldn't even deal with it. It's not like I'm a coffee virgin. 

Main problem : coffee TOO damn STRONG. Should come with a health warning. 

Another issue: always too crowded and a long wait for hot drinks. 

Plus: nice environment, cool location, great decor, pleasant-ish staff. (one was a little shirty when I thought a coffee she made was mine: thought she said Zoe but she had said Chloe)
author: Zoe L.

description: I debated about writing this as Blue Bottle has been my favorite coffee place for years. The Sansome location has a great vibe and energy.  Lately there have been two incidents that have me thinking it's time to move on. The first is where I waited over 20 minutes and when I tasted my latte it was clearly spoiled milk. The barrista quickly made a new one and apologized. Today was the opposite. It was made really quickly and the milk was just dumped  in the espresso with no care and it looks and tastes like it. It could have been Starbucks if it wasn't for the $8 price tag.  I dumped it out as soon as I got to the office...$8 figuratively and literally down the drain. I'm hoping that B.B. isn't on the way down based on too much growth. For now I'll avoid it for a bit and hope the next time wows me like it used to.
author: Barry B.

description: This is my favorite Blue Bottle location -- I come here after Pilates and it's such a beautiful and relaxing space. The staff here is also always super friendly and I'm always happy with my pour over. There are more bench seats looking out to Fidi than tables and chairs, but I don't mind too much. That being said, even on a Saturday there's a wait for your coffee, though I imagine it's much worse during the week from all the foot traffic nearby.
author: Shirley L.

description:
Blue bottle coffee speaks for itself. It's great coffee period. The waffle is heaven. Not too sweet. It's perfection. 

Latte is $4.75
Waffle is $4.50

And it's worth every penny. 

This location is ALWAYS busy and it's really loud. It can be hard to find seating. It's convenient to meet people here for a coffee due to its Fidi location but I wouldn't set up with a laptop or anything.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Always a line, but it moves pretty quickly. Don't let it intimidate you. It's worth the few minutes of waiting.I do wish there was a bit more personality in the interaction instead of blank stare and slight shrug. 
During this stop, I decided to not get coffee, and tried this fizzy lemon drink. Wanted something different, even though I love their coffee. YES! Super refreshing.
author: Amy O.

description: Best latte in the city. Tasted amazing both cold and hot. Smooth and flavorful. Homemade waffle was great too!
author: Cynthia W.

description:
I'm not a coffee person though I occasionally enjoy. 
I've had their coffee in the past and I can say that it hasn't changed one bit. 
They beat the crap outta Starbucks
author: Jason B.

description:
I've been to Blue Bottle Coffee before but never this location. This time I went with the Caffe Latte. There was a long line, but I wanted to experience so I waited. It's actually quite large inside with plenty of seating around the perimeter. I'm guessing it too about 5 minutes for my drink or to come up. It was around lunch time, but people were coming and going. It's impressive since people have many other places to choose from in the area. 

The Caffe Latte was delicious and just what I needed. They don't have a long list of drinks to choose from, but what they do have is well worth waiting for. 

Note: Walk in the area....don't drive! You won't get very far!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee is definitely spendy for a coffee joint, but very worth the fresh and rich flavors. My favorite is the the New Orleans Iced Coffee.

The space has high ceilings, clean, and would aesthetically call classy. 

I do which the staff didn't take themselves too seriously. Yes, it's Blue Bottle, a very delicious expensive coffee, but lighten up just a tad.
author: Victoria R.

description: Almost every Blue Bottle location that I have been to always has a long ass line. Here especially with all the foot traffic, expect to wait over 15 minutes. Even with all the wait, the baristas were still able to maintain good quality. I did feel a bit rushed when ordering with the cashier but it's totally understandable since this is a fast paced location. The pour over that I ordered came out well made but it came out slightly acidic. I had the exact same pour over at the Palo Alto location but the one I had at Palo Alto was not acidic which allowed me to focus more on the coffee notes.
author: Brandon L.

description: I came here yesterday and I left my jacket (that has my name on it) on an accident. Once I realized this I called but there wasn't a direct line so I decided to just come back next morning to get it. This morning - when I asked the employees at Bluebottle if they found a jacket, they told me that they don't have a lost and found and that if they found anything, they give it to the security guy. I said thanks and went to the security guy who then told me that he had my jacket on his desk but the jacket is now gone and someone probably took it. He also added that it's not his responsibility. I do agree that it is my fault for leaving my jacket but I feel that this is an extremely terrible customer service. I wish you guys would handle lost and found better or at least have a chat with the building staff. Thank you.
author: Richard Y.

description:
I came in around 10AM on a Tuesday and there were about 4 people in line in front of me.  By the time I left (about 10:20) there were about 20+ people in line.  I can't imagine how long the wait would be if you were the 20th person in line, considering my wait after ordering was at least 20 minutes and I was 4th.  I was getting anxious about the wait because I didn't intend to leave my office for that long - but ALL OF THAT being said, this was the best coffee I have ever had in my life.  If I had the time, I would wait 3 times as long.  

I never order mochas, but I was compelled towards their iced mocha.  That iced mocha blew my ever loving mind.  It's like they take a bar of the best quality Dutch processed dark chocolate and melt it and then they emulsify it into steamed milk and espresso.  What you get is this intensely-chocolatey, complex-coffee-y, full bodied in flavor and HELLA full bodied in texture, cup of luscious dream liquid.  That body tho. 

I got it with almond milk and the small cup cost $6.25.  Worth it.  100% worth it.  Is this an everyday coffee?  No, the wait time is too long, the price too high and I assume the calories quite high as well.  But as a treat yoself?  Poifect.
author: Emma H.

description: Always consistent, always friendly staff, great place to hang out with friends to catch up or to work. And their avocado toast and waffles are amazing!
author: Dan M.

description:
I've been a Blue Bottle Coffee fan for years, but this was my first time at this location. Beautiful store...great spot to get out of the rain and enjoy some artistry coffee.

On a side note, I could not believe how rude some of the customers were to the staff. Of the five people ahead of me in line, not one said thank you to the cashier. And when I picked up my drink, one guy was super rude to the barista because he had to wait (all the while talking very loudly on his cellphone). Obnoxious!! So if you go here, please be respectful. Better yet, try that everywhere you go!
author: M M.

description:
That $16 Blue Bottle cup of coffee must be made with angel's tears. 

(And you thought the $10 Jamaican at Philz was the isssh) 

When asked about why that cup of coffee is $16, one should expect an answer like this: the coffee exporter traveled in a dinghy across the red sea with only two suitcases of coffee after being kidnapped and mistaken for a Houthi Rebel, to bring the coffee of his Yemeni brethren to the Specialty Coffee Association of America (:0 there really is such a group!) read it here: 

http://sf.eater.com/2016/6/10/11907070/blue-bottle-16-dollar-coffee-san-francisco

I didn't buy that coz I love Folgers.
author: Janice C.

description: The cappuccino was divine.l and their house blend single sourced from Columbia was really good. I had them straight to taste the flavors. Nothing but roasting perfection here.
author: James M.

description:
Since this is my First Time in this coffee shop and I am seeing a lot reviews on Yelp i just want to share my experience when i was there all i can say is
- Good coffee! Good ambience if you're off from work Nice place to stay then.
author: Joseph R.

description: It'll do, but it's a space that's made for you to grab and go.
author: Theresa D.

description: Their New Orleans is the best thing that ever happened to me when it comes to Iced Coffee. Cold Brew, a little bit of milk, a little bit of sweetness = heaven! As someone who normally drinks coffee plain black, this is my little treat for special days! Service is great and super friendly, and on a late Saturday morning, no lines here. Very refreshing, because I'm German, which means that I don't jaywalk, efficiency gives me goose bumps and standing in line makes me actually nervous. Although I would consider betraying my origins and line up for the New Orleans Coffee anytime. Because it's that good!
author: Katja S.

description:
Planning my trip to SF I knew I wanted to try Blue Bottle's New Orleans Iced coffee. I chose this location because it's walking distance to Chinatown and near to the Stockton-Sutter parking garage. Thursday 8:30am the line wrapped around, but surprisingly moved at a good pace. 

Drink: 3 stars- Maybe I should've ordered a cappuccino or latte like I normally do, but I wasn't totally impressed with the iced coffee. It wasn't bitter, which is good.

Service: 4 stars- The workers are all on top of it. With that many customers, I didn't feel the wait was too long. The guy who helped us was very friendly also. 

Although it was crowded with people, we were able to grab some seats on the bar stools facing the window and enjoy people watching. I agree with the other reviews that they should have Wi-Fi and outlets to plug-in to. 

Tip: Very clean bathrooms in the lobby area behind the security desk.
author: Mary E.

description: What am I missing? I waited in line for 30 minutes to pay ~$10 for two unsuccessful coffees. The standard cold brew was bitter, without being bold (aka it lacked flavor), and was watery. The New Orleans style cold brew was overly milky and too sweet. I respect the seriousness of their chemex and aeropress equipment, and where they acquire their beans, but the execution failed miserably.
author: J. B.

description:
Being a huge fan of Blue Bottle coffee, I was thoroughly excited to try my newest find in the Financial district! 

The Iced Mocha was everything that I had dreamed off! Creamy, smooth, and most importantly, not too sweet! I love how they use 3 huge ice cubes to cool off my delicious drink! They use Clover organic milk too! :D

Credit cards are accepted via Square and they have a 4% SF employee benefits surcharge. 

The coffee shop is spacious with super high ceilings!

They even have their TCHO Mokachino coffee bars available at the cashier for $4.5!
author: Derek S.

description: You know on the fence....beautiful cafe, good coffee. Is it worth $5 for a small cup? Maybe? It's good coffee...but it may be over my head a little.
author: David L.

description:
Best coffee shop in America?  Quite possibly so.

Time to expand across America, Blue Bottle.  I hate having to wait anytime I travel to the coasts to enjoy your delicious coffee!

And love the waffles btw. They don't come better!
author: Juan S.

description:
San Francisco (Financial District): Noisy lobby

This place has long been on my bookmarked list. This was a late Thursday afternoon, near 5:30.  My initial impression was seeing turn-of-the-century meets uncluttered modern. Pretty whites accented with warm woods. Staff was friendly and efficient.  Loved the firm cap of foam on my mug of mocha. All coffees are brewed by the pour over process. Their website says their beans are no more than 48 hours out of the roaster. 

Found a nice window seat at the window bar. As I sat enjoying the view, I noticed quite a hub-bub of annoying voices all chattering simultaneously. The bar across the lobby was generating so much noise that the typical coffee bar ambience was totally destroyed. A snapshot look around showed the coffee crowd going about minding their own business but I was not enjoying  the noise from across the way. By now, I've also noticed that the taste  of the coffee was not new for me. The Hayes Valley Espresso beans were reminiscent of a great local roaster back home, being  deep and robust, with a tangy finish. It was a good mocha but I wasn't wowed. Glad to have tried it.

SIDE NOTE
There were no charging ports anywhere in the spacious shop nor out in the lobby.
author: Shal W.

description: Blue Bottle - amazing SF coffee. This location does get pretty busy, but you can sometimes find a seat or two. Get the New Orleans iced coffee. It's so creamy and delightful!
author: Steven W.

description: I came into this Blue Bottle location a couple days ago. It was a bit busy with all the office workers looking for a caffeine boost, but the line was handled really well. I ordered a macchiato and waited watching the baristas effortlessly turn out beautiful latte art! The barista who made my drink had blue hair (very fitting for working at Blue Bottle)... her name was Lauren, if I'm not mistaken. The macchiato was fantastic definitely one of the best I've had in the city. I would highly recommend this Blue Bottle location, all the baristas seem to know exactly what they are doing. I look forward to my next visit.
author: Brittany B.

description:
First visit.

Coffee was fine regarding taste, but my Americano was so small that some added milk took the cup down to room temp. Not starting off well.

Lots of discussion on Yelp about "vibe" and "ambience" at this shop, which is why this would be my hangout on a Saturday morning. Not sure whether that amazing atmosphere includes the bare wooden stools, complete lack of any power outlets or complete lack of wi-fi (cashier confirmed this with a smile, which - although politely done - didn't actually get my laptop any closer to an internet connection).

Yes, Blue Bottle, I get the hint. With my tiny cup of coffee now empty, I will promptly move along to some coffee shop that would appreciate some patrons hanging around awhile in at least semi-comfort.

One of the two stars here is for Blue Bottle playing a cut from the Miles Davis album Kind of Blue, as I packed my bag to go.

Very fitting, thanks for the send-off.
author: Kenneth B.

description:
At the risk of being the least hip millennial in downtown SF, I've come to the conclusion that BB is overrated. 

This particular location is housed in a beautiful old bank. It is spacious and gets tons of light from its full length windows. That being said, it's also constantly bustling with people at any given hour so it's not like you really get to enjoy the decor while huddling around waiting for your java.

Upon ordering my latte, the barista informed me that my drink will be ready in approximately 7-8 minutes. In all reality, it took a little over 10 plus the wait time in line to order. Oh the lucky people who don't have anywhere else to be!

I enjoyed the smoothness of the coffee (I like that the BB blend is not acidic) but I just can't justify the wait time and high prices. I always did like to be different I guess..:
author: Nina M.

description: I was recommended to to try blue bottle. I tried the ice coffee, mocha latte and the affogato. Everything was supper delish! Presentation on the latte was nice. If i ever return to San Francisco i would definitely stop by for a cup of coffee.
author: Lilly V.

description: Great little coffee shop in the Ferry building. Had the cappuccino and one of the carbinated waters. I loved the grind on the cappucino, was so smooth and was not bitter at all. Perfectly done i must say. The lightly carbinated water was great to get my palette ready for my next meal to come after my hot beverage. Give this place a try, so much better then Starbucks.
author: Moses H.

description:
Like the atmosphere but prices are high.
Pastries are not interesting looking and tasting.
author: Diana R.

description:
I honestly don't understand what the hype is about Blue Bottle. Call me a coffee snob but I only come here for convenience factor due to the fact that it's right across from my office in San Francisco. 

I've had the New Orleans iced coffee as well as a latte here and I find that they are plain and overpriced. I've had better coffee- think Sightlight also in the city. Same price but you get so much more quality and flavor than here at Blue Bottle. 

It's one step up from Starbs, but to me not by much.
author: Connie M.

description: Founded six years ago locally at Oakland, CA, and widely spread around the globe afterwords; Blue Bottle was one of my favorites espresso beans in New York City as well. Loved both their single origins, as well as the big cookies! Nothing could beat a big bite and a small sip early in the morning! Wish they could bring up more locations, not only locally, but also across the globe!
author: Elaine H.

description:
check it

Blue Bottle, Full Throttle
Monday coffee drip, that's that new motto
Muni morning commute, leisure Liege Waffle
Wait I thought that was Belgium, my geography so awful
Baristas drip it careful, caffeine of the Gospel
This not The Last Coffee, but they seem like an Apostle
Three Africas and Giants Steps, double for the combo
Pass one off to your work bae, assist like Rajon Rondo
New Orleans Ice my go-to, cold brew from the nozzle
"pour it in the paper cup please", compost desperado
Four dollars a pop, my Visa on the auto
Do this on the daily? Depending on the Lotto
Just had my cold brew, the focus is immortal
The vicious breeds the cycle, withdrawal is tomorrow.

foodkid fAAtcity
author: Ringo M.

description:
My waffle craving is starting to die down or maybe I've simply given up. Blue Bottle was another waffle stop for me and the first time I walked into this location around 5pm, I was told that they stop serving waffles at 4pm. Why???

The next time, I met two colleagues here at 8am, anticipating the delicious waffle I was about to indulge in. It was prime morning rush hour and there was a line to order and an extensive wait for the drinks and food to come out.

I'm not the best judge of coffee - most places taste fine to me. But I am a good judge of waffles. The one at Blue Bottle was very average; I still think Little Gem in Berkeley has the best Belgian waffles in the Bay.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Blue Bottle definitely has the best latte in town.  For me, it's a go-to 90% of the time when I'm nearby. 
 So what makes a latte better at one place than another?  I believe the answer lies heavily with the coffee beans and the espresso machine that makes the espresso.
Some popular large-chain cafe's have lattes than have a very distinct flavor,  a strong and familiar taste, that does not make me happy necessarily, but satisfies my desire for a latte. 
Blue Bottle, on the other hand, makes me happy. 
I look forward to the experience of sitting down in their busy fidi location too.  Always a fun crowd and good energy.
author: Erica S.

description:
I've heard a lot about Blue Bottle coffee so I was excited to check out the digs. This is a great space to meet friends and have a catchup or coffee date. It's pour over coffee, lattes, tea, and assorted pastries. Is it anything to write home about...meeeeh. Not a whole of of enthusiasm on the baristas parts. Womp womp. Kind of felt like Kurt Cobain was their idol in their expressions and excitement. 

I went with their herbal tea. There's only one option. As I'm trying to cut the caffeine that was what I had. Light. Spearmint. Floral notes. Cool. Not my favorite but it did the job. Old roomie with with a soy latte. She seemed pleased.

Lots of space to grab a seat which is a plus. You can stir along the windows or there's a large round table. We opts for lower seats in the corner. 

I had the pretzel bun which was interesting. I didn't realize that it contained Gruyère until I took a few bites and red the tag again. The flavor and greasy interior then made sense. Jen enjoyed a ginger molasses cookie which again, she seemed delighted about.

I'll use this for meetings but not necessarily much else.
author: Sierra R.

description:
@bluebottleroast high octane heaven that compliments any minute of your day! 
#foodie #travel #SanFrancisco
author: andrew E.

description:
This spot is perfect for coffee chats with coworkers and people you'd like to get to know better-- gorgeous space that is very reminiscent of New York (high ceilings, white walls, lots of windows, people in suits, plenty of seating). I stopped by yesterday for a coffee chat and suggested this spot to my colleague. I had originally planned to get the New Orleans but decided to go with the Americano last minute.

Oh my gosh, this coffee was SO strong-- as in, I finished drinking my one cup of Americano at 3pm...and couldn't fall asleep until 2am! Taste-wise, was bitter like other black coffees I've had,  but not quite as acidic. To try to fall asleep at 2am, I did read about the half life of coffee, which is 5-6 hours, meaning I was still at 25% at 2am. I also definitely felt super jittery all afternoon. Granted, I'm not a huge coffee drinker to begin with, but this stuff is POTENT. My colleague got a cappuccino and it looked yummy! I've also gotten a ginger cookie here before and it was good, quite gingery.
author: Nicole H.

description: Smooth coffee and decent bites. Slow brewed so make sure you have few minutes to wait & watch the beautiful/handsome cries come then go
author: Doug P.

description: Realy delicious almond milk cappuccino and baked items. My new favorite neighborhood coffee house, even if they were bought by nestle
author: Somphop S.

description: A nice and convenient location to grab a coffee during the afternoon. I like all the interior decor of all the Blue Bottle locations, the spaces are open and bright, good for doing work or catching up with friends.
author: Michelle C.

description: The Cappuccino wasn't hot! And there is no WiFi or charging ports at the place.. Waste of $5.. They really don't want people to sit & work from here..
author: Vinod F.

description:
Came into the store at 8:35am today and saw a line of 12 people . Normally at this time, I wouldn't even consider lining up. But after a night of not-so-good sleep, I desperately needed a cup of coffee to keep me awake. Also, I've been meaning to try this place since my coworker kept raving about it. So I thought why not? 

I ordered a latte with almond milk at the suggestion of a coworker. Read a couple of reviews that mentioned the liege waffle so I decided to order that as well. The latte was on the sweeter side possibly because of the almond milk? Not complaining though because I prefer my coffee to be on the sweeter side. Oh! And the latte art was so pretty! The waffle was scrumptious! The large sugar crystals had melted and caramelized the surface which contributed to the bite of the crispy golden exterior. The inside was chewy, yet tender. The yeasty sweetness of the dough inside was rich and indulgent! Definitely a must if you haven't tried it already. 

This blue bottle location has definitely won my loyalty because the service was excellent. All the baristas are very friendly and don't give you attitude, unlike the baristas at the philz coffee truck down the block. The baristas are fast and efficient! With 12 people ahead of me, I expected to be waiting a while. But my total wait was 10 min from the time I ordered to the time I got my drink AND waffle.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
What's not to love about Blue Bottle. I'm pretty darn happy that this location is only across the street from my building. There are so mannnnyy coffee shops around the FiDi, but somehow we end up here more frequently! The New Orleans is refreshing when I'm hot and craving a nice cold coffee drank. My go to is normally an almond milk cafe latte. They use Califa brand almond milk. It is delicious. Try it! 

This place gets awfully crowded during the afternoon. I usually stop by after my "after lunch" walks. It can get pretty loud in there too. On occasion I couldn't even hear my name get called. Boohoo. I love the interior of this place. Nice tall ceilings. They also always have this flower arrangement at the one circle table that I'm obsessed with. 

They have serve other treats (baked goods) as well. Sometimes they have their Belgian liege waffles as a sample if you're lucky! One of these days I will have to get one to treat myself. I love liege waffles.

6.7.16-I got to split a waffle today with my coworker!!!!!!!!! Buttery goodness. Fluffy deliciousness. Just the right about of coarse sugar on the outside. Drooool.
author: Dianna C.

description: I go to Blue Bottle a lot and today the barista literally hands me a cup filled 3/4 of the way and tries to tell me "that's how we always do it". I was in a rush back to work so didn't have time to argue but what the heck. Would rather switch to Four Barrel or even Philz, this is BS!
author: Alexandra C.

description: Good coffee but was a bit overpriced for the amount of coffee served. We ordered the Japanese cold brew, it was served in a small cup, with two ice cubes, coffee filled to slightly half way...I wasn't sure if this was the normal custom of SF coffee shops, so I didn't say anything except ask for more ice. I think we got about 4oz of coffee total.
author: Nana S.

description: Their coffee is fantastic and I come here almost every day before work. However, their service is incredibly slow. Expect to wait 10-15 minutes for your cappuccino.
author: Jaco L.

description:
Decor is beautiful. Simple and clean. 

The ice coffee, "New Orleans" was 10/10.
The saffron snickerdoodle was also 10/10
The cappuccino was 6/10. Wasn't hot at all, barely above room temperature. 
Inside temp was also a little warm. Not totally uncomfortable but enough to be noticeable.
author: Joe O.

description:
Ugh...it's so good, dammit, it's so good. I wish I could say a latte isn't worth $5 ($4.94, to be exact), but this one is as it is made so, so well. Absolute perfection (albeit a few caveats).

1) If you don't like sweet/sugary coffee, stay away from the New Orleans iced coffee. Yes, it has chicory, which is great and all, but for those of us who like our coffee plain and simple, it's not worth the price for disappointing sickly sweetness.

2) The drip coffee is of the hipster variety that focuses on the acidity and fruitiness, as opposed to the more earthy, chocolate notes of traditional roasts. For this reason, I avoid the drip coffee. It is excellent if you like acidic, fruity coffee, but those of us with more "traditional tastes should avoid.

3) Ugh, the prices. I mean, yes, it is San Francisco, and yes, it is not the only place forcing you to shell out $5 for a 12 oz latte, and yes, I want their baristas to be paid a fair wage because they are wonderful human beings, but ugh, it is expensive. For the economically-conscious of us, this is more of a treat/once a week venture as opposed to a daily habit (although I wish I could sustain such a habit!). 

Bottom line: Come here for the espresso and espresso drinks. If you like sugar, come for the New Orleans iced coffee (and the waffles!). They are SO well done and delicious, made with sustainable ingredients and with care.
author: Annie S.

description:
Everyone keeps talking about Blue Bottle like it's the new craze, but tbh I didn't see the hype in it.

The interior to this location was eh as it was partly in the lobby of a building and didn't have much of a seating area. 

Honestly, Philz is better.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I love the open space this location has. High ceiling with lot of outdoor lighting.They have lots of room for seating. I would love to just spend a morning sitting here drinking coffee and people watch. Super nice cafe. But I have to work, therefore only can grab and go. 

I love their New Orleans Style Iced Coffee. So good for mid afternoon coffee break. Also love their art when they are making your lattes and so on. Love blue bottle and love this location.
author: Sandy B.

description: Great location! The service is spectacular.  The store is very clean.  The coffee is the best in the city.
author: Debbie H.

description:
Their New Orleans Iced Coffee makes me jitter...it's a tad to strong for me! 

Their waffles are ok, I didn't think it was anything exciting to rave about.
author: Alice X.

description: I have loved Blue Bottle from afar for some time, having had it in a restaurant in Seattle for the first time so I was super excited when there was one near an office is was working in.  It is a cool little place to grab a quick coffee.  Definitely is not a place to sit and hang out for any period of time.  Very small and very busy.  Great quality to their coffee, I just wish it had more of an atmosphere, but it works for being in the Financial District in the first floor of an office building.
author: Kristen M.

description:
I'm a Blue Bottle addict. I'll admit it! Every time I'm in the area I always hunt out the nearest shop to get my pour over fix. 

This recent trip was no exception, but I was also famished and decided to spring for an overnight oats to go. My oh my, why have I not hopped on board this overnight oats train sooner? It was so yummy! They made theirs with pumpkin seeds, seasonal dried fruits, maple syrup, lemon juice, plus the usual suspects: chia seeds, oats, almond milk, and yogurt. Yes, I've already made it at home several times now!

Way to go Blue Bottle. I continue to be impressed!
author: Jessica M.

description:
A time not so long ago, I (gaaassssp) didn't even like coffee. Coffee to me was instantaneously associated with all-nighters and finals, and as a necessity in order to keep going. With that said, I cant claim to be able to distinguish the subtle differences between similar coffees of great quality. I do, however, know what I like, and pretty quickly caught on that blue bottle was one of the only coffees I started to enjoy for its actual taste with absolutely nothing added. 

I stop in to this blue bottle pretty frequently now. I usually get the drip they have. I'm a fan of the Three Africans and the Honduras. They rotate their drips and I've never gotten anything I didn't like. This location is relatively new (I used to have to walk over to the Ferry building for Blue Bottle) and really nice. Other items like the New Orleans iced coffee are great too. And that WAFFLE! It's an incredible waffle. I've gotten a couple people from my office to come here for the waffle. I am still yet to try the affogatto. 

Takeaway: get the drip coffee and the waffle. Perfect quick fidi breakfast to get you going.
author: Thielson D.

description:
A beautiful, spacious, well-lit location with plenty of white-marble counter tops!

DRINKS
I had a latte while my boyfriend had a shot of espresso. My latte was not too bitter and didn't need to be sweetened at all! The shot of espresso was served with a shot of sparkling water.

FOOD
Waffle: The waffles are the only food items that are prepared with each order. They serve it piping hot. I wish it was crunchier, but it is nice to have a hot waffle with your coffee.

Located in the heart of FiDi, this coffee shop seems ideal for meetings and get-together's before work. The bathrooms are located outside of the pop-up like set-up, and are better than most coffee shop bathrooms.
author: Sophie P.

description: Of course Blue Bottle Coffee is pretty much the best coffee place you can go to in the city. But this post is primarily for a new item that we were so excited to try and loved last weekend. Please keep carrying this Chia pudding. It's so healthy and filling!
author: Jeremy D.

description:
This Blue Bottle Coffee location is newer (and bigger) compared to its relatives in the area. It's on the corner of Sansome and Bush, right in the heart of where everyone meets for coffee in the Financial District. This place gets super crowded, but all the baristas make the process smooth by taking orders quickly and announcing names loudly.

Great place to get work done or just meet up with a friend or colleague for a caffeine boost. I love how clean and bright the coffeeshop is, contributing to the whole vibrant atmosphere. There's something new and fresh about this Blue Bottle location. Whatever it is, it will definitely keep me coming back for more. Just be sure to anticipate the long line and difficulty finding a seat first thing in the morning and around the time everyone gets off work.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Best coffee in SF! Might cost a penny and take longer than Starbucks but it's quality
author: Aaron H.

description: These guys accidentally made an extra shot. Instead of offering it, the shot sat on a counter until it went bad. Mottainai. I go elsewhere now.
author: Dayyan L.

description: Its the coffee in town and Bay Area!!! Since they open their first location at the beginning was their costumer and will stay!! As for me they have perfect : macchiato ,ice cream with coffee, waffles ,cappuccino  and other brewed coffee . Here the video of this location.. https://youtu.be/9IiW8XY8kP4
author: Olga G.

description:
Everyone talks about SF coffee and keeps on say Blue Bottle is the best. Daughter didn't come on this trip and wanted me to buy her some BB coffee beans. Found this one open in a Sunday afternoon in the Financial District. Very modern looking with tables and counters with large window iver looking Sansome street. 

Got my daughter Brazilian and Columbia coffee beans  by BB. About $13 a bag. Don't buys lots of coffee beans so don't know if this is expensive or not. Oh well. 

Me and my son got the New Orleans Ice Coffee cause a friend recommended this. I'm not a big coffee drinker so what the heck. We got it with almond milk instead of cow's milk cause it's supposed to be healthier for you. Ok. Whatever. Anyways,  it was really good. Didn't have to add anything and just drank it up. So good. My son added raw brown sugar and he liked his too. 

It's a great little place to sit at the counter overlooking the street as people and cars pass by. Lots of people reading books or on the computer. No wifi here though. Really relaxing spot with really good coffee. 

I know I will have to come back here again when I bring my daughter to SF. So see ya but will be back.
author: Doug T.

description:
The Good:
-Nice space/location/environment
-good coffee(practically same menu as every other location)
-theres 2 cashiers and quite a bit of staff

The Meh:
-around the late morning/afternoon, the sun will hit you 100% if you sit anywhere near the windows
-can get pretty noisy
author: James H.

description:
Maintains the vibe/interior of other Blue Bottles in the city. Conveniently located near Montgomery Bart it's a quick place to grab coffee on my way to work. Since coffee here is more on the expensive/stronger side I usually find myself coming here when I want a treat. 

I switch between getting the New Orleans Iced and Cappuccino. Both are delicious and are so strong I usually find myself finishing half of it since it gets me wired. They give you the New Orleans quickly since they just take it from tap. Also try their liege waffles here! They are the perfect pair for the coffee. They have nice sugar crystals on the corners and nice fluffy center. They do take a while to make so you'll definitely get your coffee first.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Being down the street from my office doesn't help my coffee addiction nor my punctuality at the office.  You just have to expect a wait, and hope someone in line doesn't grab your coffee by mistake.

This is my second most favorite coffee shop in SF...first one is Blue Bottle Ferry Building...just for the view.
author: Ron L.

description:
There appears to be a turf war going on in the middle of the FiDi where Bush and Battery pour into Market. Actually "pour" is a poor choice of words on a typical afternoon, maybe "slowly ooze" is more appropriate. Speaking of "pour", however, the caffeine war a-brewing in the area forces you to choose sides as to who you want to pour for you. Are a Philzaphile or a Blue Bottleholic? Capulet or Montague? Shark or Jet? I feel a rumble coming on...

BLUE BOTTLEHOLICS:
Blue Bottle's gonna have their day
Tonight
Blue Bottle's gonna have their way
Tonight

Them Philz baristas grumble
"Fair fight!"
But if they start a 'spresso
We'll 'spresso 'em right

PHILZAPHILES:
Philz is gonna hand 'em a surprise
Tonight
Philz is gonna cut 'em down to tall
Tonight

We said, "OK, no Latte
No tricks"
But just in case they decaf us
We're ready to mix
Tonight!

Before I re-enact the knife fight ballet from "West Side Story", I should let you know the new Blue Bottle space is a gorgeous re-purpose of an existing building, once the home of Cable Car Clothiers and later a computer supply store whose name escapes me. Now it's nearly 2,000 square feet of white walls and natural light that will make even the most jaded hipster smirk in delight. I came with colleagues, and sure enough, there was a line that was reaching back into the lobby of 115 Sansome. But the classic architecture was so pleasing that we weren't irritated by the wait (photo: http://bit.ly/1K6bPO7). It also helped that they were giving out free sample of their Liege waffles still piping hot from the iron.

Otherwise the menu is no different than what you get at either Mint Plaza or the Ferry Building (photo: http://bit.ly/1IYVzLR), and that includes the New Orleans Iced Coffee that appeared to be the most popular item that day. I decided to get a $4.25 Caffe Latte, and it was as smooth as a baby's bottom with the richness I've come to expect from Blue Bottle's individual pours (photo: http://bit.ly/1Fw2YND). This is where both Blue Bottle and Philz differs from Starbucks because I am more willing to patient for the brews that drip ever so slowly at these places. My toe gets to a-tapping when I order a Grande Blonde because well, what the hell is taking you so long? But at a Blue Bottle as lovely as this, well...

Today the hours seem like minutes 
The minutes go so slowly, 
And still the mocha's light. 
Macchiato so bright, 
And make this endless drip endless night
Tonight!

OK, OK...here's the real rumble: http://bit.ly/1LxSYZm

COFFEE - 5 stars...lattes that make me sing like a coloratura
AMBIANCE - 5 stars...surely one of the lovelier spots in the FiDi for a bit of caffeine
SERVICE - 4 stars...as attentive as you would expect
TOTAL - 5 stars...Philz, you may have me only half the time now
author: Ed U.

description:
I would give this place more stars because I have had their coffee before but here is the rub. My wife and I arrived and they only had one register open and a line around the corner all the way to the restroom. When we got to the counter I wanted to know what kind of single origin cold brew they had and the person didn't know. As someone who works in specialty coffee myself I would know what I was serving and I would know what it tastes like, I had it and it was good probably Costa Rica. I also ordered a macchiato and the barista said "you know that is the small kind right" ok I understand Starbucks ruins a real baristas life when it comes to what drinks actually are but you could say it not politely. The macchiato itself tasted bad like the shot was dirty. And the milk was WAY over foamed. I know I am coffee snobbing it up right now but man it was disgusting I was very disappointed. 

The atmosphere was loud but I did see a lot of people working the room keeping it stocked and clean I just would never stay there for any reason. 

But like I said the cold brew was amazing! And I did end up buying some retail I had been eyeing for a while. One bad experience worthy of a 2 star. I'll give them a 3 because I know they can be better
author: Kyle R.

description:
Such. Amazing. Coffee.

The lattes from this place are just divine. It makes Starbucks and every other coffee house look like dirty dish water.

I love that they go to so much effort, that they get your name right, that they brew each coffee individually, that it all tastes sooooo gooood!

If you're near here, even within ten miles, try this place out. 

Yum!!
author: Jemma B.

description:
Blue Bottle has arrived and today is the grand opening. I was lucky enough to get in yesterday by accidentally discovering the friends and family soft launch, where they let whomever showed up enjoy the goods for free. Don't worry, I'll be emptying my wallet here in the future, so this appraisal is not influenced by the promise of free product. Let the review begin...

Okay, the first thing to figure out is that you have to enter through the building's lobby on Bush Street (though Blue Bottle lists the location as 115 Sansome). Once you're inside, the first thing you notice is, like the lobby, the Blue Bottle space has been gorgeously renovated. A spacious, bright and airy corner set apart from the gritty, urban maelstrom and gridlock hell outside. Plentiful seating and fantastic coffee together, what is the FiDi coming to?!?!

The product, you likely already know if you're a coffee lover. If not, note that it's a delightfully freshly roasted nectar of the gods. Always brewed within 48 hours of roasting! Not too darkly roasted either. All combining for delightful and somewhat subtle complexity. I had a latte ($4.25) and a New Orleans iced coffee ($4), and both were near perfect. The caramelized Belgian waffles are made to order and sweet enough that you don't even need syrup.

I should also mention that the service is the nicest I've received at any coffee establishment in the FiDi. Alex at the counter has a great smile and is remarkably friendly. Tanner, the manager, took a second to say hi, which almost startled me given the crush of the line. No hate on the other coffee spots around here, but everyone else seems to be too busy to be nice. Note that the line was almost 20 deep but moved very quickly. These folks know what they're doing and aren't suffering from the typical just-opened confusion.

The coffee is so much better in store than the brewed-from-Blue-Bottle-beans java we get in the office that I'll likely be in here pretty frequently. I've already proposed setting up a zipline, since we're on the 8th floor, kitty-corner to the store. I won't completely abandon Coffee Cultures, which is on the other side of Bush, because they have a different flavor profile that I'm more in the mood for sometimes. But Blue Bottle has such a great space that it's a little bit of R&R just to visit.

I have to credit the expansion-minded corporate leaders for being so "un-chainy." They do such a fabulous job coming up with unique store designs to individually fit each neighborhood that their dreams of world domination just might come true. If that happens, just remember that they started in Oakland. And if they become world champs, well then that's just following in the Warriors footsteps, right?
author: Ted R.

description:
+ hot chocolate was good
+ tons of seating

- location is a bit grimy
author: Margaret R.

description:
I mean, come on. It's Blue Bottle. We all know how good the coffee is here. Smooth with subtle woodsy notes. You know it. I know it. 
But with most of the Blue Bottles around, the staff seems so bothered to be...well, there. Blue Bottle Coffee could be over the top if only the customer service was as good as the coffee.
author: Kaylie L.

description:
I want to love this place. It's beautiful. The coffee is usually a cut above. But the number of times I've gone in there to ask for a waffle, waited in line for 10 minutes, only to be told "sorry, sold out" is just frustrating as hell. 

It's waffle mixture guys. Seriously.
author: James A.

description:
came here because no other coffee shops nearby offered indoor seating or bathrooms and found an absolute gem!
beautiful coffee counter featuring fantastically morden and chic designs. seating is mostly stools at countertops with some tables and one table for a large group (6 or 7)
we got a new orleans cold brew (amazing!!) and a mocha (not as great)
cons- expensive for coffee, seemingly no outlets, bit of a line
author: Kathleen K.

description:
Let me begin by saying that I am not a coffee drinker usually but I came along with my coworkers cause they said something about ice cream. I got the affogato which is espresso over Humphry Slocombe's (salted caramel?) ice cream. 

The line was long but moved quickly and we did not have to wait long to get our treats. The ice cream is wonderfully creamy and thick with a flavor that blends perfectly with the espresso. The espresso is fragrant and not bitter. What a perfect little afternoon snack. Might have to become a regular thing, especially since it's so close to work!
author: Joan S.

description: The lattes from here are my absolute favorite, it even convinced me to buy some of their coffee and their cold brew glass bottle. The customer service here is absolutely spot on.  We went with my son and they didn't realize the hot chocolate was for him and promptly offered to remake it not so hot (which we declined but it was so nice to offer).  Of all the blue bottles we visited, this one was definitely my favorite.
author: Rachel C.

description:
It is so good to see Blue Bottle Coffee here in the Financial District. Similar to four other locations I patronized; good food, good coffee, good service and friendly staff remains consistent. I certainly appreciate the baristas taking time to decorate each coffee beverage with latte art. This is truly culinary creativity and I am very glad I made a stop here. Positive first experience here, I will definitely come again and highly recommend them to my family, friends, classmates and colleagues.

Latte and Snickerdoodle - perfect for the coffee and pastry fix.

Edit from 6/26/2015:
From my visit to BBC at The Market on Market and Mint Plaza, I tried the Pound Cake and Snickerdoodle from their pastry selection. This is when I decided to try another item and it is the waffle. The waffle is fresh and delicious, it certainly pairs well with my cup of latte. Also, I appreciate that their waffles are made to order and it really delivers freshness. Overall, very good experience here and I'll definitely be back.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Lovely space, though a long line in the afternoons that may or may not move quickly (much shorter in the mornings). If you order the New Orleans cold brew, you'll get it quickly; if you also order a waffle, expect to wait a few minutes (incidentally, longer in the mornings since there's a breakfast backlog).
 
Everyone will tell you to get the NOCB instead of the other iced coffee: take their advice. It is stronger than Philz (though I'm a sucker for minty foam), and it does have those vanilla-caramel (almost a bit of tobacco?) notes. I love having the option to get waffles with coffee - hard to find regular liege on the East Coast - but the quality of Blue Bottle's waffles also varies on the time of day (again, breakfast ones will be a bit soggy since they'll be in a rush).
author: Heidi L.

description:
Having this cafe downstairs in my office building is as good as it gets. Their coffee is amazing, and their service is even better. Ross saved me on the day I left my wallet at home. 

Their yelp page said they accept Apple Pay so I went to order only to be awkwardly told that they don't accept Apple Pay. I told Ross to cancel my order, but he apologized for the incorrect info on their yelp page and comped my coffee. 

This place is amazing...proof by the insanely long line all hours of the day. I'm here almost every day.
author: Anna T.

description:
I love how sleek and shiny this Blue Bottle Coffee place is in FiDi! Compared to other Blue Bottle locations I know in the city, I think this is the only Blue Bottle that I know of with lots of seating and feels like an actual cafe rather than just a stand for a grab-n-go drink.. minus the fact they don't provide WiFi here. Great lighting and fits the vibes. Every time I've come here there's usually a line, but it's taken care of very fast. I don't think there has ever been a time when this location isn't busy.

I always get their lattes here, hands down. Okay, maybe when it's really hot I like their New Orleans styled Iced coffee with almond milk. I'm not a huge fan of their mochas because I feel the taste is too light for me, but their latte is just right in flavor and caffeine. They also have a lot of merchandise for the coffee enthusiasts and cool souvenir cups. I'll always stick around here for as long as I'm working around the area :)
author: Kathleen S.

description: This is our go to coffee place when we stay in the City. It takes awhile to get your order but it is well worth the wait. The one downfall is they only have one size. The baristas are always helpful and friendly.  The locations can get quite packed because their drinks are so good! We went on a Saturday morning, on our last day in the city, to get our last fill until we come back in a few months. We took home some coffee and espresso beans to hold us over. They also have an online shop and the beans are roasted right before they're shipped.
author: Laura A.

description: I went here pretty much everyday when I was in SF for work. It's never too crowded or busy and the staff are very personable. Also love the upbeat music they play, a great way to start the am!
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description: When I want to impress work out of towners with coffee, I take them here. I easily find places to work every time I come in. The coffee is smooth and rich. While there might be a line, you wait inside and take in the modern atmosphere. Patrons tend to be a mixed bag of professionals. It's mostly pour-over, so don't come here in a rush.
author: Laurisha C.

description: I came here last week while traveling for work in San Francisco. High quality coffee no doubt but the prices are a little excessive. Still better than your average Dunkin or Starbucks!
author: Rachel S.

description: Nice coffee, great cookies and super hot cocoa!!! The staff is friendly, the open design of the cafe is really nice and plenty of seating. Can get loud as it is next to a pub inside this building.
author: Heliana M.

description:
Really enjoyed my iced coffee here.
Service was very nice, they have a simple but good menu that covers all the basics.
