Prices are fine given the quality, I just wish they had more than one size, since I have to pace myself to not down it all in one sip.
Iced coffee was perfect, just need to tell them easy on the ice next time, really not much coffee.
Worth returning, very good flavors and brewed perfectly!
author: Nijole T.

description: Really good coffee, nice staff and pretty building. I had the mocha and it was great. My husband enjoyed the 3 Africans.
author: Margo M.

description:
Love, love Blue Bottle and this beautiful new location. However, I felt the coffee wasn't prepared as well as the Mint Plaza or Ferry Building location.

This place is gorgeous. The clean, white aesthetic I love with lots of natural light and big windows. The round marble table in the middle is gorgeous and there's just so much room and space. I also like and appreciate the small touches. For example, the condiment bar has a place for everything, as well as a hole to pour out coffee genius.

Service was pretty efficient at the register. I got the pound cake and the waffle, both were so good! Not too sweet and still a treat. The coffee however was just okay to be honest. I got a soy latte and usually it's heaven in a cup! Given how many baristas they have, you expect the quality and speed to be great, but it was average. Coffee was already cold when I got it.

I say slow down, remember who you are, and focus on making the perfect and most beautiful cup of coffee every time. I still love Blue Bottle and will come back, but let's hope this is teething opening problems.
author: Billy S.

description:
Yummy, strong coffee all for a reasonable price in the FiDi!

Came here in the morning before work and the line actually wasn't too bad - the people working here are totally in hustle mode, so it moves quickly. I tried the classic New Orleans Iced Coffee, and although I normally don't drink coffee unless it's sweetened to the MAX, I really liked the flavor!  The taste of the good quality coffee was prominent but not overbearing. Also, that drink is deceptively STRONG! The size is pretty small but about 90 minutes later at work I was totally jittery and bouncing off the walls (given, my caffeine tolerance is pretty low). The cafe is a great, mod spot to study or do work and I'll probably be back if I ever need a serious pick-me-up in the morning.
author: Desiree S.

description: My friend suggested that I should try this place out and I really liked the look of this place. I liked the high ceiling, the open space with lots of places to sit and the set-up where the baristas were. I ordered the caffe mocha and liked how it had a really strong coco flavor and was a little sweet; just to my liking. while my friend ordered a New Orleans iced coffee with almond milk. Really nice place, wouldn't mind coming back here again!
author: Audriana S.

description: Love this place. I come here every time I'm in San Fran for a latte and an avocado toast. Great service and great coffee and food!
author: P. K.

description:
Having walked by here a few times and getting discouraged from the monster crowds, I finally dropped in this morning.  I guess early morning is the best because the line didn't snake to the elevator banks!  I ordered a cafe mocha ($5).  The drink was good.  Not too sickly sweet and just the right amount of coffee to wake me up.  Size looks like a tall at the Bux.  I also picked up a ginger molasses cookie to be enjoyed later today.

The store itself is beautiful.  Open space, bright and airy.  I also loved the lobby area - real beau arts design.

Service was quick and friendly.  They even took the time to draw some art in my coffee.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Boss bought me a sample set Blue Bottle beans and I've been hooked on the beans prior to even coming into one of the spots. 

I actually work across the street and never noticed it was there... Blue Bottles are super incognito. There's nothing on the inside or outside that really screams coffee shop and even the cups are pretty chill. 

I'm a fan of their coffee.. they have a variety of more flowery tastes and more chocolate-y ones too. They're not cheap though but the quality is evident. 

Unfortunately no outlets here, so you can't cheeeel for a while.
author: Aria S.

description:
The hype is real, and I still actually like this place better than all the other "hype" coffee places (Sightglass, Four Barrel etc). New Orleans is still the "go to" year after year. The hot coffee of the day is consistent and delicious. While Sightglass serves a better "drip", their coffee comes only what I can call a "Starbucks kid's hot cocoa" size. What's up with that?

I really could care less if this place is a "sellout" business. If they cut into Starbucks market-share and force higher quality coffee - long live Blue Bottle. I hope it happens.
author: Doug R.

description: Blue Bottles are turning up everywhere throughout the city.  Stuck in the middle between two Philz locations, this one gets a good amount of traffic.  I never have to wait too long because I order a New Orleans burly with soy, which they are able to serve when I pay.
author: Justin Y.

description: The line, though long, moves quickly. The coffee is decent, though a bit milky for my taste. Baristas always seem slightly rude on the pick up side but nice enough when taking orders.
author: Amber H.

description: Beautiful location this one is in. It's right at the corner of Bush and Sansome, but attached to a  larger historic building. Larger open space similar to the WC Morse location, except not as big or as tall of ceilings. Also at this location, you order at the register instead of with the baristas. lovely cappuccinos and lattes. The usual. Good service. Orders made relatively quickly even single drip pour over.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Caveat -  I am not a coffee drinker but I do go to coffee shops. It is usually to meet someone or grab a quick snack. 

I know some folks had palpitations when they heard about a BBC location opening up here. They do not have a big selection of snacks but I do enjoy what they have. A huge plus is that they are not as crowded as the location in the Ferry Building. Thank goodness! I
author: Sunil R.

description:
Blue bottle coffee deserves 5 stars regardless of lines, they always put out a great cup of coffee! While I am more of a drip coffee or americano person, I have had their new orleans blend, lattes and macchiatos. Consistently great!

Bonus, if you are going to wait for coffee, might as well as get one of their delicious waffles, prepared fresh. Make sure to get enough so you don't have to share, or else you will be back in line for another round!
author: Lauren M.

description:
We determined this was a good place to meet friends for a coffee as our experiences have always been good or better when it came to coffee and Blue Bottle. 

At this location there are lovely high ceilings, big windows letting in lots of light, an attractive tiled flooring, a beautiful floral arrangement and a delightful fit out which all combine for a quality environment - a place you just do not want to be in and not not leave. 

And so what about the coffees?...the cappuccino's were excellent, the macchiato too and so too the other coffees. The waffle was popular with some. Whilst we did not indulge in other treats they also looked very moreish. What I believe keeps bring me back to Blue Bottles Cafes is that the barista standards are high and accordingly the coffee quality is consistent, made with care  and has lovely lasting flavour. And it mostly comes in china cups.....

We really enjoyed our hour and so in this Blue Bottle - and the coffee too..
author: Mick A.

description: I loved my cappuccino! It was outstanding...Best we have ever had! The blue bottle cafe is located in the financial district. Very nice location. The staff is friendly.
author: Lyn S.

description:
My first time at this location.  Always a fan of BB coffee. Great place to sit down and take your time savoring your morning cuppa. Definitely a poll ace to visit whenever I am in the city.

This is a checkin/review more for the location than the coffee which is pretty much always consistent with smooth strong flavor
author: Vikas J.

description: This blue bottle location is divine. Amazingly well lit, expansive and decorated. Feels like you're in London. If you're in the area, stop by!!
author: Inga C.

description:
I've been a Blue Bottle fan for years, and this location is alright.

There's a line, but it's shorter than it looks.

Drip coffee ranges from three to four and a half bucks (a little over priced for my taste).

I've also had the americano (a little on the small side, a thick, almost meringue-y texture to it) and the latte.

God damn, those lattes.

I've had a few blue bottle latte's over the years, and there's something about the richness of their espresso that perfectly matches the consistency steamed milk. It's desert-like. Sweet in the absence of sugar. Not scalding hot--just warm enough to touch your heart.

I feel like it's a bit decedent to have everyday, IMO. And while I'd choose Blue Bottle over coffee shops like Starbucks any day, the more of these pop up, the less special they become.
author: Tony L.

description: Good coffee, cool space, BUT no power outlets anywhere. Just FYI for anyone that was planning to hang out there and use a laptop.
author: Hilary H.

description:
Not my favorite blue bottle location. From the outside, the place looks huge and like they would have a lot of seating. But this place is pretty consistently packed, with a long line, and it's hard to find seating. There's not too much seating and it's too loud to really get much work done. There is a bit of seating on stools along the windows. 

Just like the other locations, the coffee is good. My personal favorites are the mocha and the new orleans iced coffee. 

Side note, someone left their bag by the table, so I asked around to see if it was anyone's. And when I brought it to an employee, she seemed displeased and probably too busy to deal with me. So she sent me to bring it to someone else in the back. I asked two employees before someone took the bag. Spent 5 minutes asking employees to just hold the bag behind the counter to keep it safe. Eh.
author: Julie L.

description: Great coffee, takes a bit longer to get a cup than other places. However, lovely atmosphere.
author: Casey S.

description:
This place blows if you need to get work done, here's why:

1) No Wifi
2) No plugs
3) No sunshades on the windows so you're blinded if you're sitting anywhere near the windows facing Sansome

Coffee's fine so that's good I guess
author: Itsahme B.

description:
In the city and i am in the mood for some bomb coffee in the early morning. I knew i wanted blue bottle coffee, but do i really need to stop in Oakland for it? Luckily i went on yelp and found this spot nearby. I knew this location won't be the best compared to the one in Oakland. But i just want the coffee more than the surrounding. 
. 
Walked in and was like yea, this place is pretty awesome. I love how they still promote the same antique vintage vibe when you walk into this place. They even try to use the same white floor tiles for the front entrance, which shows they care about the decor. 
. 
i like how this location is across the street from a Walgreens and Target. There are plenty of meter parking in the AM. Great and convenient for my first experience here. 
. 
Of course i had to get the New orleans style blue bottle coffee. it was on point and never disappoints. Great presentation as well. i was a happy guy in the AM with my coffee. The barista that took my order was nice as well. Also there were plenty of seating, so yea sit down and slurp away. Thanks for reading.
author: Alex T.

description:
Is it okay to give this place 5 stars because I'm just that much in love with one item? Their New Orleans iced coffee is amazing. It made me start loving coffee. 

I always hear people rave about the New Orleans iced coffee and when I first tried it I didn't think it was any special. A year later, I tried it again because I was craving an iced drink on a hot day. And boy was I glad I gave it another try! My opinion on the drink totally changed - it's so damn good! It's strong, kind of bitter, but sooo soo soo creamy even if you're not using whole milk. Only down side is that it only comes in one small size. I'm always a bit sad when I finish this drink because I want more. 

There's something about drinking out of their blue straws that match the logo on the cup that make the coffee taste a bit better. One of my coworker thinks the same, the other doesn't. Give it a shot and you be the judge.
author: Michelle T.

description: This outlet well-decorated its place! It is on the classier/ businessy scale so if you're looking for a more professional and upscale setting to enjoy your coffee, this is the place to be.
author: Linda K.

description:
I love how close Blue Bottle is to the office now! FYI- you need to go inside the building to get to Blue Bottle. They're offering free drinks on their opening day. 

Alex, the cashier, introduced herself to me and was very helpful. Props for customer service!

Free coffee + pretty new location. With Philz and Blue Bottle moving into the area, I'm wondering how Starbucks and Peet's will react. LET THE COFFEE GAMES.... BEGIN!
author: Chris W.

description:
Hipsters unite!  

Two guys actually asked me to take their picture "for a friend who works here".

I had the "Liège Waffle".  I was a little surprised because I thought I was ordering coffee.  It's listed up there on the sign that has all the coffee drinks and that one tea drink, so who knew it wasn't some fancy name for coffee?  Yes, that was me standing there oblivious while you were calling my name, waiving around a fresh, hot waffle.

Well, it was delicious.  Not too sweet, with a rich, eggy flavor, it has a lightly caramelized dusting of sugar and a soft, caky texture that tugs when you pull it apart.
author: Sondra H.

description: Very bad service. The staff look they don't want to be here. All angry.  Maybe they should have some of their own coffee
author: Mohssine K.

description: It's free coffee day at blue bottle! Got to meet James Freeman and had many samples. Greatest coffee store ever. You know it's great coffee when you start hearing Jazz music immediately after drinking.
author: Joshua B.

description: Isaac helped us decide what to choose it was our first time here. He was super friendly and helpfully and the coffee was delicious!!!
author: Ash T.

description: Waffle Wednesdays are always a hit with the yummy waffles from Blue Bottle. The only downside is the REALLY long wait, so be prepared to spend 20-30 minutes on a typical morning ordering and waiting for your order. If you're just getting coffee it's usually a bit faster, but not by much. BUT IT'S DEFINITELY WORTH IT! The waffles are freshly made (not prepackaged and heated up) and come with this yummy sugar caramelization.  The coffee is pretty good too, though I've only ever had their soy latte and iced coffee.
author: Rachel E.

description:
YAY new blue bottle right across the street from where i work! this place can get pretty busy (theres usually a line). the line usually takes me about 5-15 minutes and another another 5 mins to get my order. so don't come here if you're trying to get a quick coffee before running off to a meeting! 
other than the coffee, i recommend the affogato! waffle is aite.
author: Annie S.

description:
5 stars for their coffee but minus 1 because
sometimes they run out of their coffee on tap (for the New Orleans iced coffee). You can't really go wrong with anything from their menu and if you catch them at a good time (around 7:30am), there is absolutely no line! Best feeling when you walk through those doors and see no one standing and then a whole group of people comes through. (In my mind, I'm like YESS!!).
author: Polly L.

description: This is my favorite Blue Bottle location (and it doesn't hurt that it's the closest to the office, too). The building is really interesting with its old tile & big doorway, and the huge windows in Blue Bottle are great when the sun is streaming in, and fun for people watching (inside or out) even when it's overcast. There's a nice selection of baked goods and the freshly-made waffles are a treat (the best is when little squares are given out as samples!). And most are probably already familiar with the coffee, which might not be as exciting/unusual as when it first came to the scene, but is still solid.
author: Lisa K.

description: It's good but not as good as I thought it would be. And they can't customize your coffee. I asked to cut the sugar by half for my iced new Orleans, and the barista was like "we don't do that because we want the best for you." Interesting, you know what's best for me better than I do. Okay, I would give it a try and it turned out it's just the right level of sweetness I can take for a coffee. That I was happy. But the downside is melting ice kind of reduced the flavor. If only they could make the ice cube by coffee as well. That way I will give them a 5/5.
author: Nancy W.

description:
*UPDATE - I dropped a star because the won't make waffles after 4:00pm, even though they're open until 7:00pm.  Wut???  That's complete arbitrary nonsense.  "The delicate hipster fingers cannot do hard labor with waffle irons after 4:00pm."*

Blue Bottle is good but it's definitely a rip off. I love their New Orleans cold brew (although it's more consistently good when you buy it pre-packaged in the cute milk cartons), their waffles are delicious (but only when piping hot - don't delay eating it!), and the whole vibe and design of the location is very cool. 

However, the prices across the board, even for the pre-packaged New Orleans coffee, are out of control. I got an iced latte with almond milk and an extra shot of espresso in a cup no larger than a Starbucks small for $6.25.  The extra espresso and the almond milk were each a one dollar upcharge. You think that for an extra shot at one dollar, which is going to take up more room in the cup, maybe the extra charge for the almond milk could be knocked down to $0.50...

Either way, it's sort of a ridiculous...  Are we really going to let a cup of coffee get to the level of an "artisanal" cocktail?

Oh, they made me the wrong drink on the first go-round....with the crazy line at 1:30pm, I was there for about 20 minutes...

PS - why no simple syrup?  Sugar doesn't dissolve so well in iced drinks, especially not the fancy, organic sugar in the raw that seems to be the only thing good enough to touch their precious drinks. Or any form of artificial sweetener - you guys know some people are diabetic, right? Ugh, gag me...
author: Tay H.

description: I have been coming into this place for well-made drip coffee as it is close to my office. Today's visit is very disappointed. When I told the barista that I want to have my drip coffee here, she pulled the coffee in a paper cup directly into an unheated glass mug. As the temperature of the mug is lower than it should have been, the coffee didn't taste good. Little things, such as warming the mug before pouring coffee, are what makes Blue Bottle special. I'm hoping this is the last time I've seen this.
author: Lena P.

description:
I'm a regular at Blue Bottle's Hayes Valley location.  On a hot day, the New Orleans style iced is about the best thing ever.

I ordered my favorite at the downtown location this morning, a "burly new orleans iced coffee."  I watched as the guy filled the plastic cup half full of ice and coffee, then the other half milk.  What I'm saying is, *way* too much milk.  You can see through their new clear plastic cups just how milky white this drink is.

In short, came in looking forward to a burly iced, came out disappointed with coffee-flavored milk.

Regardless of what you order, expect (a) awesome decor, and (b) long lines.
author: Dave C.

description: Living in Chicago, I go to Blue Bottle Coffee every time I'm in SF. When friends tell me they're visiting SF and ask for recommendations, I always point them to Blue Bottle Coffee. Quality coffee. I wished they'd open a location in Chicago.
author: Teri Y.

description:
I am obsessed with Blue Bottle.  I love their marketing, logo, and simplistic style of the blue bottle.  

Definitely try the New Orleans iced coffee -- it's amazing.   Bizarre tip you probably won't believe: get the carton premade version.  I promise you it's actually better than the "fresh" cup.  I've made all my coworkers test this theory -- and literally everyone agrees.  Plus it's super convenient to just buy these cartons for the week.  

Also, the Affogato is soooo delicious.  Definitely a treat and worth a taste!
author: Michelle S.

description:
I love coffee but i admit i always stick to the same thing, a "vanilla latte". Yesterday when i was walking to bart i noticed the staff was putting the finishing touches to the cafe. It looked super clean, fresh, modern and cozy. 
This morning I made it a point to see if they were open and to my surprise they were and there was no line. I ordered a latte (they don't have sweeteners) and a muffin..... it was about $7 total. I thought that was a bit steep since the coffee cups are small.... it was be a "tall" at Starbucks. 
My latte was delicious, it didn't need sweetener or anything else. This was definitely a great treat and a great way to start off my morning.
author: Irma R.

description: I'm a big fan of Blue Bottle and I'm so glad this location is less than 2 blocks away from where I work at located in the corner of Financial District. It's so easy for me to get my New Orleans Iced Coffee fix now and I love the staff. The décor is also on point, super hip vibe compare to most Blue Bottle's I've been to through out the Bay Area.
author: Danny L.

description:
Spectacular new hidden location (sort of) as Blue Bottle stakes a spot in FiDi in the brewing coffee war grounds that is SF. Note the pun please with compliments haha. Currently amped on the 'Bucks though. Dollar dollar bill y'all. 

Wow what an open and beautiful high ceiling white decor. Check it out but it almost feels like their should be an Eataly behind this and the NYC subway rumbling beneath. 

As for the coffee, get a New Orleans as it's what sets Blue Bottle apart in the coffee wars. Or an espresso. Get your fix here with what Philz doesn't offer or if you need a fancier cup than the 'bucks. Check the location out, it is beautiful and the coffee keeps up while leaving your wallet a tad lighter. No wonder the caffeine buzz felt stronger. 

Cheers!
author: Joseph L.

description: This location is spacious, light, and doesn't seem to get too terribly crowded.  I was pleasantly surprised by the New Orleans iced coffee.  It is pre-sweetened, and I was bracing for something overwhelmingly sweet or syrupy.  I ate (or drank) my words at first sip.  The iced coffee had just a tiny bit of sweetness--just enough to balance out the acidity.  The drink didn't make it one city block.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Food & Drink: I got an iced americano and it was smooth enough to drink black and no sugar. My fiance had the cafe latte and yup, best one he's had (his words).
NOW the Caramelized Liege Waffle is to die for! Just the right amount of crispy, sweet, and fluffiness. Love, love, loooooove!

Location: One block up from Montgomery BART station. Gorgeous building; lots of natural lighting, high ceilings, pretty architecture.

Customer Service: Very sweet and helpful.
author: Paula R.

description:
If you are a fan of dark, strong coffee (as much of San Francisco is) then Blue Bottle is a no brainer. Enough said. 

So why come here over all of the other coffee options in the area? 

This particular location has walls painted a bright white with complementing white marble and wood designs. The combination of this, the high ceilings, and large windows makes you feel instantly more awake as you stand in line for your coffee. One downside to this is that sound echos a LOT in here so it's not the place to have a conversation or do work. 

 Although the actual store is on the small side, the line wraps around outside into the hallway so it doesn't feel crazy cramped. Another nice touch is that there are multiple stations to get spoons/napkins/sugar etc so no one area is densely occupied. 

Overall, a good place to come and wake up knowing you can get a solid cup of coffee without having to deal with pushy people.
author: Kailin L.

description: I absolutely LOVE this beautiful new space! While my allegiance to coffee still lies with the likes of Four Barrel and even Coffee Cultures, Blue Bottle's newest space is just so inviting and almost begs you stay awhile and people watch while munching on a warm waffle fresh off the iron.  The single origin cold brew is delicious and something I'd definitely get again! Welcome to the neighborhood Blue Bottle!
author: Lisa I.

description: I love the coffe here. I got the New Orleans coffee and it was one of the best one I had. Also my dad got the drip coffee which he was really satisfy with it. If blue bottle comes close I would go everyday but for now o can't.
author: Robert L.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Blue Bottle, and this space is larger than just a counter. There's plenty of seating in a large well lit open room. The location is also conveniently located in fidi.

Only problem - no wifi, so not the best place to get some work done.
author: Cynthia X.

description:
We all know Blue Bottle is my main squeeze. If I need a coffee, I will go out of my way to get a blue bottle. This particular one is in a great location, close to my apartment and to my school. 

Let's start with the goodness...in comparison to the Ferry Building Blue Bottle,  this location has lots of seating and makes the perfect spot for people watching.

The only downside is the lenght of the line during the week...it's always long! Since it's situated in the bottom of an office building,  it's prime location for all the FiDi employees to grab a coffee. On the weekends, there usually won't be a line.

Overall, another great Blue Bottle offering all your typical Blue Bottle items, from coffee to waffles. Yay Blue Bottle!
author: Aletta B.

description:
SWKEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!! --- that about sums up how excited I was when I learned that Blue Bottle Coffee opened ONE BLOCK away from the office. Excited. Yes. very VERY excited.

I have always been a huge Blue Bottle fan..I want to say it was before the hype, but I honestly don't know if that's true.I always get their iced coffee or a latte. Both are great with none of the bitter gross aftertaste..and just enough umph you get you happy-wired, but not jittery. 

I love it! I love how its so close and love how people are super nice. Go around 10ish to avoid the morning coffee rush.. :)
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I was craving a treat so I decided to try their affagato (ice cream with a shot of espresso).
I wish it would have said on the board that the ice cream has chunks of brown butter inside the ice cream, which unless you like eating raw butter, just wasn't my thing. 

Thankfully, they were able to fix my order and replace it with a latte instead, but that affagato cost me $7 with tip, so it wasn't cheap and it wasn't good.
author: Jackie H.

description: I don't typically enjoy being uncaffeinated standing in large lines with strangers.... but I thought I'd make an exception for this place. Looking back I feel like I made the right decision! The lattes here are to die for and their whole bean Bella Donovan coffee is even better! They've got strong espresso and bold coffee that I've been brewing at home ever since. I'll definitely return for more drinks and to try their breakfast next time!
author: Heidi J.

description: This is the one and only blue bottle coffee shop I've ever been to. Love the atmosphere, enjoyed the coffee. A good place to stop by.
author: GRACE K.

description:
It is so nice to have a Blue Bottle Coffe close to my work. The location,location location is perfect. It is right near the Montgomery Station Bart. 
The line was 20 people ahead of me today and I received my coffee in five minutes wow that's organization ,very impressive.

They truly are a great coffee place with quality coffee,friendly service and great efficiency.

They are amazing and such a great example of true consistency. 

Will be bring friends and clients here soon.
author: P C.

description: Loved this Blue Bottle! It was empty and relaxing and the restroom in the back was so clean. Nice pitstop amidst the chaos nearby Embarcadero. Better to chill here for coffee than the Ferry Building.
author: Kristen Q.

description: Great coffee! Smooth and perfect temperature. The waffles looked and smelled great. Everyone at the shop seemed to be enjoying them. I did not have one but was jealous of everyone around me eating them.
author: Amanda A.

description: I love this little coffee shop! It's bright and airy. The coffee is GREAT and the staff friendly and professional. Thumbs up all around!
author: Robin J.

description: I recently got the Honduras coffee and a waffle and both were so good! The coffee was smooth and the waffle was fluffy, chewy, and not too sweet. Such a great pairing! The ambiance of this location is welcoming, light, and airy. The customer service was pretty good too. I plan to go back!
author: Stacie S.

description:
New Orleans Iced Coffee, I could drink you everyday if I'm not trying to limit my coffee intake. I tried it two years ago but remembered not liking it. Tried it again and I am hooked! Strong, yet still creamy enough to my liking. 

And this location though! I am in love with the white marbled aesthetic and the windows that give the place natural lighting. It might be my favorite location of Blue Bottle yet. 

The line was long on a Monday morning (of course) but it moved relatively quickly. The service was friendly and I got my drink in an instant. 

I had my eye on that liege waffle while waiting as I watched them make it in line. It looks sooo good! Definitely coming back to get that.
author: Emily M.

description: Loved the Hot Chocolate here as I'm not a coffee/tea drinker. Was rich and not to sweet/watery. Keep going here often. Only complaint, is that the place is always filled!!
author: Apurva R.

description:
There is some serious coffee game going on in the FiDi. I am immensely jealous of the choices folks have in their laborhood. When it comes to coffee allegiances, I embrace all forms of caffeination. While I am born and bred Red State (Intelligentsia, Chicago), I always have love when I find myself in Blue territory. 
  
This particular Blue Bottle just opened up in the lobby of a beautifully marbled historic building. When I visited BB it was just two days old. The line looked way more manageable than Philz so we queued up. Between the single origin cold brew and macchiato, everything was prepared attentively. For a mid-day pick me up, seating was limited with a consistent line of people awaiting for their fix. 

TIL (6/23/15)- Blue Bottle is reigning in their coffee experience and is no longer supporting their wholesale division. For those loyal BB'ers outside the territory, it's going to be a pilgrimage or you take on the task of making it at home. http://tinyurl.com/ome4vxv
author: Jenny H.

description: Despite of loving their coffee, I'm not going to wait for it 30 min anymore. Next door Illy's customer service is much better and faster
author: Julia S.

description: The staff here are very controlling about what you may order. Asking for a lesser amount of espresso was impossible, as was having a small amount of cold milk to put in one's tea. Either one had to have half-and-half, or the barista would pour straight from the Clover bottle and decide how much milk you should have. It's a shame to pay close to $20 for disappointing drinks and the wry British pleasure of rolling one's eyes at SF pretension at its very height.
author: Dominique G.

description: Amazing drinks and super friendly staff. My new go-to place for a calming cup of hot chocolate, I can always count on Blue Bottle to perk my day right up!
author: Manal M.

description: I feel bad posting such a negative review, but wow, did my friends and I have a bad time here. We came in on a Friday afternoon when it wasn't particularly crowded. My two friends ordered first, then I ordered a cold brew. The person at the register handed it back to me with milk in it. I hadn't asked for milk, and she hadn't asked what kind (I can only drink almond milk), so I had to give it back for her to make another. Then, new drink in hand, I went to go wait with my friends for their espresso drinks. We were waiting for over 10 minutes, again, without much of a crowd at all. We overheard someone else asking about where there drink was and receive a really rude reply from one of the baristas. As we're waiting, I realized that my drink was sweetened, which is again, not what I ordered, but I didn't want to ask again so I kept it. My friends' drinks finally came out and we left. Maybe 30 seconds later my friend says her espresso is so bad she can't drink it and throws it away. I also throw away my super sweet cold brew. One drink is actually acceptable of the three. So in short, we overpaid for coffee, then waited too long for it, and then it was horrible so it went straight in the trash. Never again.
author: Gianna M.

description: Can't get enough of this place! Their lattes are amazing and paired with the waffle?! Yum yum yum!
author: Ryan S.

description:
Goddamn their affogato trumps all.  

It's the perfect afternoon pick-me-up, and I swear, if you pair this with their freshly made warm leige waffle, you might just collapse into a pleasure coma.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
I use to go to Blue Bottle of 66 Mint Plaza. Very different experience, better. There the cappuccino is served on real cups and they have silverware. I like Belgium waffles but here they gave me the waffle wrapped in coffee filters. I asked for plate and silverware and they don't have. Then I asked for syrup as I use to ask in the other blue bottle but they didn't have too. I'll keep going to the other blue bottle. 
The place is cool, I don't know how it looks like with many people inside. The place has very high ceiling and there is a lot of echo. Crowded this could be veeeery noisy.
author: Juan C.

description: God forbid you customize your drink order. If they do get it right, it's good, but most of the time they don't because  they seem to care less. If you dare bring it to their attention, they will insist their drink is perfect... yes, when you go to blue bottle, the baristas are always right, not the customers. The baristas have an incredibly curt and obnoxious attitude. I've decided long ago to no longer pay $5+ for inconsistently good and consistently bad coffee -with an attitude.
author: T K.

description: I truly appreciated the quick and friendly service. I've only visited once and I ordered the New Orleans iced coffee.  It is well worth the 5-block walk from my office and I will be back again soon.  I was even able to grab a seat to sit and enjoy during a busy rush.
author: Jessika S.

description: I debated between 2 or 3 stars and decided to not be a jerk. I went this morning, and noticed a rather large group of people waiting for their coffee. Being lazy, I said...meh, I'll wait a few minutes. Over ten minutes later and $8 less in my pocket (it's overpriced for a coffee and slice of bread), I was still waiting. I actually don't mind waiting if I see the staff is working to get the coffee out - these ladies though...my goodness. Can you chat later? Maybe you can stop making coffee to laugh and gossip when you don't have 25 people waiting for their coffee so they can go to work? I'm just saying..The coffee is good, but not 15 minute wait good.
author: Cindy D.

description: The first time I walked by this place I thought it was some sort of private club. So beautiful with the open windows and all white minimalistic decor. Extremely good coffee. I've been here multiple times now and the staff is polite and professional. There's almost always a huge line but don't be put off by it. They're used to handling 20 people in line and they have very fast service. I've had their cappuccinos and lattes and they're both very good. Can't speak for their pour overs but I'm sure they're good as well. It's a great place for good coffee, one of the best! And if nothing else just go for the interior. Find a seat and watch the bustling city.
author: Lisa O.

description: Service was good and baristas were nice and welcoming. Kinda disappointed that there was no wifi when I really needed to contact someone. I ordered a latte and it seemed more like a cappuccino and the espresso shot was kinda bitter. Maybe I'll try some other drink next time
author: Ludo D.

description:
15.06.29.  

Compared to all the Blue Bottle cafe ... 
this place ...
  One of the most beautiful
  Largest space
  Transportation accessibility ... many
  
Opened on Wednesday

The latter is exceptional
author: S.K. Y.

description:
I heard some good things about this place so I decided to go here. What was a huge turn off was that there were very little few people working and the line was horrendously long! Waited a couple more minutes and the line didn't seem to move so I just left.

If you're looking for a quick place to get a coffee, I wouldn't suggest this coffee shop because they seemed to be understaffed.
author: Aj C.

description: Certainly there are worse places to get a great cup of coffee in SF
author: Patrick T.

description: Good coffee. Unfortunately, the reviews were incorrect. I came here for a dose of wifi before meeting a friend. No wifi. Wish I had known prior to my purchase.
author: Jay K.

description: The New Orleans was just what I needed.  I also had the lemon/poppyseed streusel.  Make sure you warm it up.  Tastes much better that way.  The line is long so plan to be away from the office for a while if you plan on getting coffee.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Blue Bottle is synonymous with the Ferry Building. I work in the FiDi so I never really make my way in that direction. However, once they opened up a location closer to my office, I've been there more than a handful of times. My two favorite things are the New Orleans style Iced Coffee and their waffle. 

The New Orleans coffee has chicory syrup in it and is reminiscent of a Vietnamese Iced Coffee in flavor but not strength. It is still cold brew coffee but without so much bitterness. It's the perfect balanced coffee drink pre-made for for the casual coffee getter. No need to add milk or additional sweetener.

The waffle is served warm by itself. When you walk into the building you can start to smell the butter from these waffles. It is light and fluffy and a nice little nibble in the morning that pairs well with your coffee. Even though it smells like it should be saturated in butter, it's surprisingly airy. Doesn't leave you with a heavy feeling in your stomach. 

All in all a great addition to the already grand selection of coffee located in the FiDi.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
I left my heart in San Francisco should really read "I left my Blue Bottle coffee in San Francisco".

As someone born and raised on coffee (I'm from Seattle), it's hard to admit that I found better coffee elsewhere. Blue Bottle is one of those places that would absolutely make a killing in Washington (so, they should move up as quickly as possible).

I like the New Orleans style drip which the barista actually recommended on my first visit when I tried to order a latte. It's a bit sweeter than the latter and more full-bodied. I admit I haven't done a sweeping consensus of what Seattle's coffee scene offers, but I haven't quite had a drink like this one.

This particular location is in a financial bank building and its decor reflects that. Very clean lines meet marble with the right tint of gold to make the place just pretentious enough. I'm a fan :).

Great coffee. Great service. Just not close enough to me.
author: Megan Y.

description:
This place is overrated. Usually when you see a line out the door for a coffee shop, who's logo isn't green and white, the place should be a legitimate hit. With such artisan equipment and method for brewing coffee, in conjunction with the hype that is Blue Bottle Coffee I really just expected more. 

We waited about 15 minutes after the initial morning rush to order a latte, the New Orleans iced coffee, an olive oil cake, and a frittata. Both coffees were very small relatively speaking, and the priced as if you were getting something 20 oz. I don't really have an issue with the prices, but for the price I expected a stellar latte and iced coffee. The latte wasn't even hot, and there was really nothing special to the New Orleans Iced coffee, which is supposed to have a slight chicory accent. The food was very good though, definitely more impressive than the coffee.

With Blue Bottle coming to the east coast, I'm willing to give it another try, but initial impressions were mediocre.
author: Niran A.

description:
The location is great and it's one of the best looking coffee shops in the area. I've pretty confident that I've been to every coffee shop around and I would rate the coffee as average, maybe average plus, especially considering the price/quantity. The food/snacks are very good, though. One thing off putting about his place though is that the order takers tend to be a little snooty, as though we are so privileged to be allowed to order from there.
Overall, I'll take visitors here so they can try it, but I'll get my coffee elsewhere.
author: Jason C.

description:
Visiting from the east coast and thought this was a cool place to check out. The waffle was delicious!! The drink was good... but the staff... HORRIBLE!

I'm a freakin tourist. And guess what tourists do? Take photos! 

So I snapped an overview picture while waiting for my order. Then this barista comes up to me and says: "We'd appreciate it if you ask for our permission first before taking photos of our faces". I apologized and he just walked away...

I deleted the photo right away. 

Then the same guy gave me my waffle and I said: "Sorry about the photo. I deleted it." A simple "thank you" from him would've been fine. 

But no. He said: "We're just making coffee, we're not street performers."

... ... ...
author: Wendy D.

description:
Love Blue Bottle, but while the coffee never disappoints, the staff here is hit-or-miss. The last time I was in, the line was wrapped around the lobby and finally one of the staff members begrudgingly (she looked at the line and rolled her eyes) sauntered over to  the other register to help. 

Listen, I don't need an excessively peppy barista to enjoy my experience, but having people that seem pained to be there and pained to interact with a customer is disappointing.
author: Megan S.

description: I'm really not a huge coffee drinker but this place has woo'ed me to no end. I absolutely love this place! Everything about it- the location, lighting, decor, simplicity of menu and the friendly staff. You can tell these people love their art of coffee making. Go early though - the line gets out the door!
author: Jill S.

description: Great coffee! Every drink is hand crafted! Pure art in the world of coffee. No matter where I go or live, I will always be a blue bottle admire.   Great food as well. Those chia yogurts are amazing.
author: Mary W.

description:
I've only been to this Blue Bottle for morning meetings, but I love it! 

The interior is really spacious. It actually feels a little cavernous...the only downside to that is that the ceilings are so high and there is no noise absorptive material, so it's kind of echoey and loud. It's hard to hear when they call your order if you're in the seating area further away from the bar. 

Otherwise, the quality of their drip coffee is great (kind of hard to screw up pour over, I admit).
author: Grace M.

description: Amazing coffee. If you like flat white, ask for their Gibraltar coffee - it's not on the menu. You will love it!
author: Tatiana A.

description: The coffee is great here, the baristas are always pleasant, and the location is always pristine, but you'll pay a bit more for it. That said, the Liège Waffle is AMAZING. They make them fresh to order and you don't need to dip it in anything...it's just as sweet & savory as it should be. It comes in a little wrap and you can eat it on the go.
author: Daniel B.

description: Nowhere better for snobby coffee. Really enjoy the drip (really pour-over) coffee here, as well as the waffles. Walked here from Union Square for coffee and breakfast every day of the conference that brought me to town.
author: Jake V.

description:
The first time I had blue bottle in the east bay I thought it was just okay. I started working in downtown, and after ditching my pick up order numerous times from philz because they were late 80% of the time I decided to give blue bottle another try. 

All I have to say is..the cappuccino they make is blind blowing! The espresso is smooth like a baby's bum and I still get excited to see what my latte art of the day is going to look like.

Thank you for helping me get by the monday blues and making me feel like a rejuvenated hamster- I can finally be productive at work.
author: Carmen A.

description: I'm not a big coffee connoisseur so I don't generally visit Blue Bottle Coffee, but I had to write a review for this location.  When Postmates canceled my order last minute, I was stuck running last minute to get 9 coffees for an important meeting.  The staff was extremely helpful and Anthony carried my coffee back to the office with me so that there were no spills.  I am extremely appreciative of this and will definitely return to this location in the future!
author: Allison Z.

description: Not sure what would make a 16oz iced coffee almost 5 dollars but still interested to taste more.
author: Desirae B.

description: I love this place! Instead of Starbucks once a day I decided to try some other better quality spots a couple times a week. Blue Bottle is one of my favorites that I have found. I love a plain black iced coffee and their cold brew is some of the best. On the recommendation of a friend I tried the Affogato and it was amazing!!!
author: Justin M.

description:
The BEST Blue Bottle location (shhh, also best kept secret)!

It's spacious, bright (with many windows), clean, and has plenty of tables and seating. 

The coffee is delicious as usual ( I can't get enough of the New Orleans Iced Coffee) and the liege waffles are amazing! They're very generous with the size of the waffle here and they're made fresh to order. This location does not have the food menu like the location on Mint St., looks like the only food sold are pastries, granola+milk, yogurt.

Another thing that I love is that this location is not very crowded and stays relatively quiet on weekends - perfect for reading or getting work done!

TL;DR
- Get the hot fresh liege waffle 
- First timers, try the New Orleans Iced Coffee
- Plenty of tables and seating
- No WiFi : (
- Walk-able distance from Union Square and Montgomery and Powell BART station.
author: Monica T.

description: You have to order the waffle. It's made fresh and tastes like heaven! There's a punch of cinnamon and only costs $5. It will change your life.
author: Ameera D.

description: No matter what time of day this Blue Bottle is popular BUT don't fear the line! The coffee is worth the wait. My favorite choices are the New Orleans Iced Coffee or your (not so) standard latte. On a occasion I decide to treat myself and get a waffle while I'm there too - you should definitely get it the next time you're there :) Blue Bottle, I love you a latte.
author: Teresa C.

description:
Meh, not my cup of coffee I guess. I've never been the biggest fan of Blue Bottle to be honest, just a little too dark and bitter for my taste, and I've never been a fan of their New Orleans cold brew. However, when this convenient location opened up in FiDi (and open on the weekends to boot) I decided to go check out their regular Single Origin cold brew. 

The space is beautiful, located just across from the Target express on the corner of Sansome and Bush/Pine. It has high, vaulted ceilings, marble floors, and the space is minimalist and open with some light seating. The baristas were friendly and happy on a Sunday morning.

The single origin cold brew was pretty good, not too bitter, and not sour, my biggest pet peave, but true to Blue Bottle form, it comes in a pretty small 10/12-ish oz cup (guessing the size). They also don't have any simple syrup!? Look, I get the whole no "flavored syrup" rule at third-wave coffee roasters, truly, but simple syrup is just sugar and water for people who are getting iced coffee. They also don't have milk at their sugar and milk counter, just half-and-half, but they were very accommodating when I asked for some.

Good location, better options elsewhere unless you really love Blue Bottle.
author: Kate M.

description:
They made a bad latte but they were nice enough to remake it

Some nice staff, some snotty and precocious 

I like their NYC shops more
author: B. M.

description: Perfect! What better than a blue bottle at the heart of the financial district? Here I come, New Orleans Iced Coffee!
author: Nizar S.

description:
I've had prepared blue bottle coffee and I like their drinks. This bad review is for their coffee beans. 

I wanted to something nice for me team, so I decided to bring my French press to work and grab a couple of bags of coffee beans. I asked the cashier if they could grind these for me and he said no. It's a coffee shop that sells coffee beans, mugs, filters, etc. but they won't grind beans for a customer?! 

I left without any coffee and went to Philz on Front St. They were happy to grind the beans and we're just as shocked when I told them about my experience with Blue Bottle.
author: Nichole P.

description: Came here on a Friday afternoon and was pleased. The service was quick and friendly and we enjoyed our coffees.
author: Ari R.

description: Super rude girl working the counter. I understand you don't have wifi but you don't need to have attitude. A place in Fidi SHOULD always have wifi.
author: L D.

description:
Luckily the line was really short when I got there because by the time I left it was wrapped around the wall. I ordered a small drip coffee. The coffee wasn't my favorite coffee but it was A-OK. Next time I'll try a different type of bean. 

It does take a little while to get your coffee since each cup is made one at a time so this isn't the best place for a grab and go cup of joe.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
This is an excellent location, about mid-point between the Ferry Building/Embarcadero Ctr and Union Square/Downtown madhouse.  If you're traversing between these points, it is a perfect spot to recharge with your favorite caffeine.  BBC's entrance is connected to the main lobby of the building and it's a nice touch.  High open ceilings and big windows with ample bar and table seating.  Attentive staff with an open bar to watch the brewing action.

My double espresso with rich crema was spot on.  Right up there with Intelligensia/Chicago. Nice shot of mineral water chaser to clear the palate.

My bud's latte was rated a 3 on a scale of 5.  I was told I make a better latte on my La Pavoni than the big machine at the counter.  Presentation however, was 5/5.
author: Joe R.

description:
Damnit why did you have to open in the bottom floor of my work???? I SPEND SO MUCH MONEY HERE NOW. 

But ugh that ice coffee is worth it.  My only complaint is the price, because I LOVE everything else about this place.  It's absolutely beautiful, and the coffee is delicious and strong.  It's usually pretty packed, but I've learned at what times of day it's a bit slower, and that's when I go.  Even when it is packed there's generally a couple places to sit and enjoy your drink and the line goes by quickly so don't let that deter you. 

Ambiance: Bright and magnificently instagramable 

Price: High for coffee but the quality and flavor is WORTH IT 

Customer Service: Fantastic, they are really chill and lovely baristas
author: Christina L.

description:
I get blue bottle free at work so I'm not sure why I even bother coming here. Oh because it recently opened and I prefer colder coffee. 

I get the New Orleans which is perfect in every way. I would give this pace five stars except the lines are very very long with all my fellow yuppies
author: Ray H.

description: Employees are louder than customers. All they do is gather around and laugh out LOUD.
author: Kil C.

description: Magical. Love their New Orleans Iced Coffee. If ever I have more time I want to try the slow-bar. But the iced coffee is delicious. It's like ice cream to me and definitely gives me the caffeine kick so I can function for the rest of the day. Found the line was okay at 9:30 but it's always a bit of a gamble if you go. You can never tell when there is a wave of everyone wanting their delicious coffee.
author: Erin T.

description:
When I feel like indulging - affogato plus waffle
When I need to wake up asap - espresso plus latte
When I want to satisfy my sugar tooth w/o feeling guilty - iced New Orleans with almond milk
author: Dorothy L.

description: Short line when I came in after lunch on a weekday. Small space but service was efficient and got things moving. Ordered a latte, and I was in and out pretty quickly. Paid with a credit card and got my receipt in my email.
author: Teresa G.

description: Another fancy but average coffee shop located in the heart of financial district. There are about 30 Starbucks's, 100s of other coffee shops (including Phil's) in this tiny FD area. I like the location of this place, it's located in the nice historic building on a corner of the block. The entrance is they the building, the line is usually formed inside the building and you can keep warm (in cold chilly afternoon) by staying inside the building while waiting in-line.
author: Mark Z.

description: I love blue bottle. I didn't know there was a location here, but when I found out I visited it 3 times in a week. I always seek it out, and love the cappuccino and espresso. I normally don't get other coffees here, stick to the bar.
author: Jonah K.

description:
There is zero sense of urgency here. There was no line and yet I'm still waiting 15 minutes for a coffee.

Totally overrated. Go to coffee culture across the street or Phil'z. In fact, you could get coffee from both places in the time this place could make you a single cup.

Honestly, is this a joke? Seems like a 2010 hipster fad that just won't die
author: Chase E.

description:
I had the drip coffee, as I wanted a nice smooth cup of coffee. Very disappointing, it had a weird aftertaste.  Would not return.

Person who made the coffee had a poor attitude.
author: S W.

description: My favorite Blue Bottle in the city. The lighting is awesome in here and the high ceilings create a very nice environment. Come here during the weekends to get reading or some work done. It's a bit to hectic during the weekdays.
author: Bill H.

description: I have avoided this place since it opened because it seemed too precious. I appreciated the whole blue bottle thing when it started, what ten years ago? But jesus today it was so annoying. Long line. My friend, who I admit is high-mai, asked if they could put sugar in her latte before they steamed the milk. Annoying? Maybe, but a big deal? No. Our cashier asked the "baristas" only to come back and report, "They said 'No.'" Wow. No apology. Just nothing. And the latte was lukewarm and the almond milk was revolting. And we paid $1.00 extra for the revolting almond milk. No thanks.
author: Rachel P.

description:
Overpriced & over-hyped. The new Orleans cold brew is not as good as actual coffee in NOLA. It's too bitter, and acidic and if you ask them to add sugar to it, its too sweet, yet still bitter. 

Try Philz instead, larger coffee selection, every cup is freshly prepared, and its more reasonably priced.
author: Trena M.

description: Had a cold brew with milk. It's not something I usually get so my reference was a bit off. It was pretty tasty still though, just nothing amazing.
author: Yanir R.

description: So awesome there is a Blue Bottle even closer to my office now. I dropped by here today on my 15 minute break and it being brand new the line was huge. I decided to bite the bullet and trudge through the line since it was moving at a decent pace. I eventually got to the front and ordered a Caffe Mocha and a waffle. The cashier was very friendly and nice. I got the waffle within about 5 minutes. The Mocha unfortunately took close to 10-15 additional minutes to get! My little 15 minute break then turned into my half hour lunch. I know the place just opened and lots of people were there, but man that's a long time to wait for a cup of coffee! Fortunately, the waffle was absolutely delicious and the mocha was fantastic (giving me and extra burst to get me through the day). I definitely will come back here, but will make sure I have some time to spare since it moves a bit too slowly for my liking!
author: James R.

description: I am a big fan of Blue Bottle coffee. Yes, their service is a bit slow, their coffee is a bit expensive but it's still the best coffee in San Francisco. I'm so glad to have this new location!
author: Svetlana K.

description: Cute coffee place in downtown. Tried the new orleans expecting it to be on the sweeter side. I was actually dissapointed since it tasted more bitter than sweet and all the reviews for this coffee were so positive.
author: Lisa D.

description:
I almost convinced myself that there's rarely a large crowd here because no one knows how to get into the storefront. But that simply can't be true... can it? 

I really love the coffee here. It's just really good. I get either the Latte with the single origin espresso shot. It's a pricey coffee for sure but it's always delicious. The iced coffee is good too, and probably the quickest drink to grab since the cashier grabs it for you after you order. 

It's pricey for coffee, but priceless for good coffee.
author: Jeannie L.

description: good coffee, super long lines and barristers seem to be fresh from the college - did you mean tea or coffee? .... oh, ...  and the attitude runs pretty high, ... but the space is really nice to hang and sip the torturous products.
author: Jane T.

description:
I like the old building, the high ceilings are pretty cool.  The line can be long but I felt it moved fast.

Blue Bottle is my favorite coffee and we ended up here on a Saturday because Peets and Philz were closed, so we walked a littler farther and had a New Orleans iced coffee with soy.

I think they added way too much ice at this location :(

The Cappuccino is, as always, super perfect tasting.  After going to the Blue Bottle at the Ferry Bldg for years, I have notice the cup gets smaller and smaller as the price inches up.

What's our breaking point?
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Thank you, BB, for opening up in the heart of the fidi. So convenient for us folks in the neighborhood. Waffles, cookies and New Orleans iced coffees are going to me my go-to here. 

The space is lovely and actually has tables and chairs to sit and lounge with friends. You get a good glimpse of the busy area through their big open windows. The service here was great (here during the first week they opened!) and look forward to more coffee dates.
author: Joy A.

description: If you are in San Francisco, you have got to try Blue Bottle Coffe. Make sure to visit THIS location!
author: Nour C.

description:
Great coffee and good customer service.
The cashier lady rejected the girl who was so close to cutting me in line and helped me first... Most definitely satisfied with my experience here ;)
author: Jane J.

description: you can never go wrong with blue bottle! its quality is just as good as few years ago when they started the shop in ferry building.
author: Lovetea C.

description:
Love Blue Bottle coffee and the waffles are sublime. 

I wish it wasn't as loud in the space - some good sound proofing would make the whole experience more enjoyable.
author: Edith L.

description: Got the latte, the coffee is not too bitter. They offer take away food for convenience, and a good selections of coffee choices. Good service, didn't have to wait long despite the queue
author: Ee Wen W.

description:
I found salvation in the Three Africans Cold Brew. It's literally the best coffee I've ever had and I don't know how I'll settle for less. Tastes like dark chocolate while its just unsweetened, black coffee. 

My boyfriend really liked the New Orleans Cold Brew and we both enjoyed the Giant Steps drip coffee. All I can remember is that Giant Steps was described as "viscous & fudgy" and that's 100% accurate, again just black coffee. 

Hope the cans are just as good, because that's all we have in SoCal!
author: Bailey B.

description: It was good but not that much what I expected. To me, this place kind of overrated. I stopped by this place when i went to SF for business trip. I got so many recommendations so i tried. Yes it's musv better than like starbucks or other big franchise company but not enough to give them 5 stars.
author: Vivienne S.

description: Rotten customer service. I ordered 4 waffles to go. I'm waiting and I see the guy open the lid and turn them over. they were lightly brown at this point. Then I see him making coffee. I figure, he knows when the waffles are going to be done. People behind the counter see me standing there and after a while, it would have courteous to see what I was waiting for. I finally walk up the counter and lo' and behold, another person is pulling out the waffles and tells the guy who put them in there that they're burnt. He turns around and knows it's for me. No apologies at all for the mistake. All he says is, "We have to make them again." I'm at lunch.. I don't have 30 minutes to wait for another batch. But this is what I came here for. So, batter goes in for another set of 4 and the timer is set. I ask the OTHER person, (because by this time the guy who burnt my waffles is staying making coffee) I ask HER how long it's going to be because I have to get back. She says, "I just put them on" and walks away. At this point... had I not paid for it, I would have walked. She comes back, looks at the timer and says, "it'll be another two minutes" Okay. fine. I'll wait a little longer. So, another person comes back and he is tasked to take out the waffles. He notices there are other orders AFTER mine for waffles and that they were out of dough. Good going guys. It'll be a long while before I come back.
author: Pauline S.

description: Their coffee is just so so, I ordered a coffee latte, but it just warm, not that hot.but the waffle is worth to try.
author: Wing T.

description: Quality Staff! Quality Service! Quality coffee! They're name calling process does suck a bit, the place tends to be pretty crowed due to its popularity so I can be pretty difficult hearing your order being called. I personally recommend the Affogato(ice cream with espresso) if you like Sweet, Strong and VERY rich! Hands down my favorite Affogato in town. Sadly this is the second time in a row I've come in and they were out of ice cream... Which is the main and only reason I come in when by myself. Which does put a dent in my day. I'm scared I'm going to walk all the way here again only to find out a third time, they were out. Sigh the richness of it is addicting though.
author: Justin R.

description:
Flat white is not the same as a cappuccino.

I have been going to blue bottle locations for many years and favor them over other local shops.  However, this new location has me worried.  I ordered a flat white but when the order came up (20 mins later due to what seemed to be a grinder malfunction), I got a cappuccino.  It is totally fine to say that you can't make a flat white, or even lie and tell me it is a flat white, but now I will probably walk a couple more blocks to get a better coffee.  For a brand that prides itself on quality, I am very disappointed that this location lied to me when ordering.
author: Carlos M.

description:
Excellent atmosphere... Without a doubt the best coffee in town.
I recommend trying the Affogato ( icecream with an espresso shot )
author: Samuel M.

description: Clean, ample seating, conveniently located right across the street from target. Good service and great coffee. Just no wifi!
author: Patricia S.

description: Moved to SF from LA about a month ago and this is the coffee shop I have really attached myself to since they have locations in both cities. I love the small sizes of drink and the pastries are divine. I'd tell you my favorites but don't want them to ever be out when I go in. Don't be discouraged by the line and try a waffle.
author: Alline B.

description: I came here in the morning and was pleasantly surprised with the location and decor. It's open with a number of seats along the window. The coffee shop itself is really beautiful. I saw them making fresh waffles and felt a sting of bitterness that I can't eat gluten. They smelled divine. My hot chocolate was pretty tasty. I'd take this over Starbucks any day.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Finally found my favorite drip coffee "the three Africans" and New Orleans ice coffee.
Pros: 1) amazing three Africans drip.
          2) New Orleans ice coffee.
Cons: 1) just one paying counter is open, consumes lot of time.

Coffee is expensive but it's worth it.
author: Kdev K.

description:
Got a latte.  Was delicious.  Nice and creamy.  Line was out the door but it went fast.   The waffle looked delish, but I held off since I had a breakfast burrito in hand from Rio.  

Service was great and so was the ambiance, so
FIVE STARS!!
author: George P.

description: So far my favorite cold coffees are from here - the normal and the New Orleans are both great, and the waffles are fresh and warm and really good.
author: Deepan M.

description: The Cassara iced tea is good.  However, it's a small cup.  For that price, it should be a large cup, with less ice (not large cubes so you get so little to drink it's not funny).
author: Matilda R.

description: Personally I feel like the ferry building shop is better quality/speed. Ordered the latte with almond milk today: $5.25 for meh coffee. The lines here are absolutely ridiculous in the afternoons and even when the lines aren't that long service is pretty slow. Nothing negative about the coffee just overpriced... but then again it is SF.
author: Taryn Q.

description: First time to try BlueBottle.  I was impressed.  Excellent coffee and engaging service. Was surprised how crowded the store was...obviously a very popular place.
author: David B.

description:
A real life conversation at Blue Bottle today: 

"Me: Two flat whites and an espresso to go: 
Him: The espresso will be for here. 
Me: No, everything to go please. 
Him: We can't serve espresso to go. 
Me: Huh? 
Him: We aren't able to put it in a to go cup. 
Me: Can you just pour it in there please? 
Him: No. (in a whispered tone) it loses the flavor if you put it in a cup. You see, the cups are 8oz and an espresso is only 2oz. 
Me: ....No smaller cups? I really don't mind if its in a bigger cup... 
Him: Sir, I'm afraid we aren't able to serve espresso to go. 
Me: Uhhhh, okay, just the flat whites." 

Seriously the most pretentious and classically SF experience I've had in a while. The coffee is fine. Coffee Bar is better though, and with far shorter lines. The space is cool. Too bad it reeks of holier than thou coffee snobbery.  Note to management - invest in some Dixie cups.
author: Joe B.

description:
Sorry Blue Bottle Sansome, learn to make your iced coffee like your other locations. 

I ordered a New Orleans Iced Coffee (which I have had numerous times before at other locations) and watched them barely fill it with coffee and load it with milk (1/4 coffee, 3/4 whole milk). When I called them on the exorbitant amount of milk they just put in my cup, the worker explained to me 'that's how it's made' and went on to the next customer.

Not sure I'll be back to this location.
author: Sam R.

description: This place is great, the poached eggs are incredible! I also had the cherry toast which was really good but something you want to share.  The cappacino, waffles, and bacon were also really good.  Poached eggs are a most have I could have eaten a hundred of them.
author: Matt W.

description: I ordered a Liège waffle and an Opascope espresso. The espresso started a bit harsh but had an extremely tasty finish. The Liège waffle was a joke. It was basically just pound cake cooked in a waffle iron. That has nothing to do with Liège waffles. Fairly good service, considering how busy it was.
author: Callum S.

description: Place is BEYOND AMAZING. Line is always long, but it's worth the wait. If you're in a rush, tell whoever's waiting to wait longer because you're about to taste heaven. I'm serious. Blue bottle coffee puts coffee on a different level. I can't even put Starbucks, Peets, and Coffee Bean in competition with BBC. I'd say places like Stumptown, Verve, Temple, Intelligentsia, and Forge is probably in competition, but even then BBC is the BEST!
author: Gabriel C.

description:
Absolutely beautiful, state of the art (whatever that means with coffee) Blue Bottle location. Typical long line and a bit of a wait for pourover, but a lovely space. Friendly baristas/cashiers. The waffles looked great, but I was hoping for an actual food menu to make it a one-stop shopping destination for coffee and breakfast.

To the JERK to found my money (several folded $20s) on the floor and pocketed it: thanks for being a good samaritan and turning it in. Happy Friday, you sure made mine awesome. P.S. Karma.
author: Corinna L.

description: Wow. I didn't enjoy my drip coffee years ago when I ordered it. This time I ordered the iced latte and definitely enjoyed the roast and quality of the coffee bean. Prices are definitely on the higher price range but if you enjoy your coffee, this is the place!
author: Lily M.

description: Had the waffle- not too sweet, it was perfect for stopping on our way to the 49er game!
author: Shelly L.

description: Great spot for an excellent cup of coffee in the FiDi. The aesthetic of this location is top notch. There's a nice selection of baked goods (just enough so that it's not overwhelming). The only downside to the great coffee served here is that at times there can be a lengthy line (for ordering and then for your drink).
author: Matt S.

description: I really feel for the workers here. It is the loudest coffee place I've ever been to. I work next door and the coffee is delicious. Also like the almond meringue rocket. I'll give it that!
author: Debra M.

description: I was very happy with my experience at Blue Bottle Coffee. I had a waffle and New Orleans style iced coffee. The quality of food and service were both excellent. I will happily return and have also been recommending friends and colleagues to go here when in the area.
author: David C.

description: Really good coffee - with really expensive prices. I love the location being right next to Montgomery bart, making it a quick stop before my morning shuttle to the office, but I hate how they don't have those..cardboard cup things that prevent the cup from burning your hand - almost burnt my hand ordering a latte the other day.
author: Zoe H.

description: Love blue bottle coffee! The New Orleans is perfect and the waffles are very good! Love the location and service is fast!
author: Tyler H.

description: A blue bottle to start a day! This cafe stood out coz it has a high ceiling and transparent windows! I felt calm and happy when i was there.
author: Chang L.

description: I asked for NONFAT cappuccino, even confirmed with cashier they have nonfat milk, cashier said "Yep" but then the barista still poured down FULL FAT milk into my coffee. What is this place, trying to put fat in my drink? Their tiny couple sips worth of cappuccino will rack up so much calories cuz of that milk. You should never promise your customers nonfat milk if it won't happen. To me it is quite a big deal, I'm not cool about these things and I care about these details to look the way I am so that's why I'm disappointed at this location and never coming back. If anyone wants nonfat milk espresso drink they should pass this place cuz they ignore your request and are not honest about what's in your full fat drink.
author: JY H.

description: Blue Bottle Coffee is what completes the San Francisco experience. You can't go wrong with their New Orleans Iced Cold Brew.
author: Vhalerie L.

description: Beautiful new location.  Just opened up right by the office, and thank God! However... it does mean that I don't have as much of an excuse to walk all the way over to the Ferry Building for a NoLa or anything else they offer.  The light streams in, marble tables gleam and make it impossible to leave without lingering.
author: Chloe B.

description: The store has installed a band of matte screen since my last review! They listened, yay!!!
author: Yummytummy W.

description: Shame on Blue Bottle, they recently added in a line item for a "Healthy SF Surcharge." Most folks will not even catch they did this. To add insult to injury they have chose to collect 4% when the tax is only 3%!
author: Brian K.

description: Good coffee, bad attitude. Maybe it was the SF heat that made the cashier cranky but she had major attitude when I inquired about the New Orleans iced coffee.  Part of the reason I leave the office for my afternoon pick me up is to have a friendly smile with my cup of joe. Otherwise I'd brew my own cup and smile at my coworkers. Get with it chica- being in the service industry means being nice when your day blows. Will I return? Probably. But if this girl is still cashiering with a nasty attitude, I won't be back   a third time. Just sayin
author: Rachel B.

description: Great espresso, but that's never a question with blue bottle. The new location is so convenient to work and it's in a beautiful new building. Couldn't be more excited.
author: Sarah G.

description: BBC is the prized coffee of choice in the Bay. With such a designation, expect long lines and limited seating. It is worth it if you are the kind of person that cares about good, strong coffee. Me, I'm okay with Peet's...but I do appreciate the occasional cup of Blue Bottle.
author: Rex M.

description: THE SLOWEST COFFEE IN THE WORLD. Prepare to wait about 15 minutes for a cup... And no not the drip coffee. Happens every time. It's actually incredible how rude they are and how long they take. Yikes.
author: Anna C.

description: Have been crossing this coffee bar since a while and finally gave a try. Coffee and the breakfast bar met my expectation level and was pretty satisfied and happy. Somehow, not giving 5 stars as they don't have option of honey and just 1 standard milk/cream. Will definitely come back though.
author: Sameer K.

description: I am a Starbucks diehard but this place is truly good.  Can't get a macchiato at Starbucks but the waits here .... My go to has figured out.
author: Eileen B.

description: Experience: A fairly consistent long line with customers (I counted 15) being serviced by one cashier who was also making iced coffees and handing out pastries. At the same time an army of employees are busy behind the counter, but this does not match up with the actual minimal output (I counted an average of 1 coffee a minute?). I like the coffee but unfortunately many people in the financial district have no time to wait in line for 15 minutes because of inefficiency (on purpose?). Manager kept insisting on their quality, which I do not argue with, but one can maintain quality while increasing output (will benefit both Bluebottle and the customers).
author: A M.

description: Good coffee, mediocre pastries. Lines are unbearable in the morning, I don't know why they don't just have more than one cashier when the lines are 15 people deep.
author: Chris K.

description: I don't like maxing out a review, but I can't give them only 4 stars.  They are super friendly and serve some of the best coffee in the bay area.  Plus, their baked treats are dynamite!  This location in particular has not yet failed me, but has perfectly extracted the brown dragon everytime.  What's more, if I ever had a suggestion to improve the drink construction, they listened with open ears and open hearts, because they seemto truly care about the product and customer satisfaction.  Kudos Blue Bottle!  All the gourmet with none of the sass.
author: Justin J.
